title: chevalier_d'eon_(fate)
body:
Saber-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The Knight of White Lilies, their Noble Phantasm is Fleur de Lys.

d'Eon's gender is [[1other|not identified]], and they possess a skill that allows them to [[genderswap|switch]] between the two. d'Eon's real life counterpart was biologically male and [[crossdressing|crossdressed]] while undercover as a spy before [[gender transitioning|transitioning to living as a woman]] later in life. They briefly wear a purple [[maid]] uniform during the Agartha chapter.

title: zundamon
body:
[b]Zundamon[/b] is a character who was originally created as [[VOICEROID]] [[Touhoku Zunko]]'s pet since 2017, but received an official [[personification]] and later a text-to-speech voicebank under the [[VOICEVOX]] software in August 2021. She later received a singing voicebank under [[NEUTRINO (software)|]] on July 31, 2022. She is a [[Zundamon (UTAU)|zunda mochi fairy]], and can transform into Zunko's bow called "Zunda Arrow". Its projectized arrow is used by Zunko in order to change a normal [[mochi]] into zunda mochi.

After the release of her text-to-speech voicebank, Zundamon became immensely popular within Japan and later aboard, to the point that she has completely overshadowed her original master Zunko.

Her gender was unknown until her human form's profile was released, describing her as a [[tomboy]]ish girl. Nevertheless, as [[VOICEROID]] characters are predominantly female, she is a popular target for [[genderswap]]s.

Her human form has [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] tied in a [[low ponytail]] with two [[pea pod]]s on her head, and [[yellow eyes]]. Her outfit is a [[puffy short sleeves|puffy short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], [[green shorts]] held with [[suspenders]], and [[green boots]].

If Zundamon is only depicted in her [[Zundamon (UTAU)|UTAU]] (mascot / zunda mochi fairy) form, do not tag with [[VOICEVOX]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6748007
* !post #6745135: Reference sheet

title: zero_shiki_(gundam)
body:
A fictional manned [[robot]] from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It was first featured in the Mobile Suit [[Zeta Gundam Define]] [[comic|manga]] from 2011.

[b]MSZ-000 Zero Shiki (Type 0)[/b]

A prototype [[mobile suit]] developed by the [[AEUG]] by combining design elements from both the [[Rick Dias]] and the [[Delta Gundam]]. It resembles a red colored [[Hyaku Shiki]] and was first test piloted by [[Quattro Bajeena]].

[spoiler]Karaba MS Ace [[Amuro Ray]] later received a unit painted in white and blue colors.[/spoiler]

title: camazotz_(fate)
body:
An NPC introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Nahui Mictlan (fate/grand order)|South American Lostbelt]]. The Mayan bat god of the underworld. He is responsible for forcing the aspects of [[Xochitonal (fate)|]] onto [[Kingprotea (fate)|]], turning [[Beni-enma]] into [[Beni-enma Alter]], and turning [[Ereshkigal (fate)|]] into [[ereshkigal alter (fate)|Ninkigal]], making them enemies against Chaldea. [spoiler]He is revealed to be [[camazotz (beast i:lost) (fate)|Beast I:Lost]], a human king with the moniker "The King of Braves", a nod to his voice actor (see below) who had taken all of humanity's sacrifice to gain immortality and Beasthood in order to defeat [[ORT (type-moon)|]].[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Routo]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Hiyama Nobuyuki]]

title: magella_attack
body:
A fictional military combat vehicle from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] anime TV series from 1979.

The [b]Magella Attack[/b] is a [[tank]]/[[starfighter]] modular mechanized combat unit from [[Zeon]]. The turret of the tank can detach and function as a flying combat starfighter/aircraft.

title: blonney
body:
[b]Blonney[/b] is a playable character in [[Reverse:1999]]

A stereotypical of "extravagant rich girl". She is one of the main character of [b]A Nightmare at Green Lake[/b]. She loves horror movies, and she references a lot of slasher horror movies such as [[The Texas Chainsaw Massacre]], [[Child's Play]], and [[Friday the 13th]]. She is also [[Jessica_(reverse:1999)|Jessica]]'s best friend. Her real name is [b]Jennifer Woods[/b]

She was voiced by [[Addison Holley]] in English, and [[Saito Shuka]] in Japanese.

title: twilight_(spy_x_family)
body:
One of the three main characters of [[Spy x Family]]. He is a spy with his real name unrevealed; he uses "Twilight" as his code name. Also known by his cover civilian name [b]Loid Forger[/b].

He is operating in the setting's analog of [[East Germany]], under the cover identity of "Loid Forger". As part of this cover identity, he is 'married' to [[Yor Briar]] and 'father' to [[Anya (spy x family)|]].

He is voiced by [[Eguchi Takuya]] in Japanese and [[Alex Organ]] in English.

h4. Other names

* [b]Lloyd Folger:[/b] Transliteration used in earlier official English translations.
other_names: ロイド・フォージャー

title: yor_briar
body:
One of the three main characters of [[Spy x Family]]. She is an assassin under the code name "Thorn Princess". She use her signature ring-pommeled [[stiletto (weapon)|]]s as her weapon.

As a part of her cover identity, she is pretending to be the wife of [[Twilight (spy x family)|]]. Both characters are unaware of the other party's secret identity. She is also acting as stepmother for [[Anya (spy x family)|]] and adores her new stepdaughter. While she's off-duty, she works as a clerk at the city hall.

She is by voiced by [[Hayami Saori]] in Japanese and [[Natalie Van Sistine]] in English.

h4. Other names

* [b]Yor Forger:[/b] Née "Briar", assumed 'legal' name after 'marrying'  [[twilight (spy x family)|'Loid Forger']].
* [b]Yoru Folger:[/b] Transliteration used in earlier official English translations.

title: time_paradox
body:
A chronologically impossible scenario, such as a character meeting their older or younger self, or two characters from different time periods meeting, even if one of them should be dead or shouldn't be born yet.

For example: [[Asahina Mikuru]] meeting [[Asahina Mikuru (adult)|adult Mikuru]], [[Revolver Ocelot]] meeting Major Ocelot, or [[Altair Ibn la-Ahad|Altair]] meeting [[Desmond Miles]].

title: nekopara
body:
A visual novel revolving around [[Sayori (neko works)|]]'s original [[cat girl]] characters. Localized to English by "Sekai Project":[http://www.sekaiproject.com/].

So far, there are six "episodes" in the series:

h6. Episode 0

Episode 0, which is counter-intuitively the second novel released, is a short "fandisk" that takes place before the events of episode 1, and gives the player character's sister a much larger role. It's also somewhat of a showcase of new features not present in the first game, which include the ability to directly interact with the cast by clicking on them.

h6. Episode 1

Episode 1, the first novel released, centers on the characters [[Chocola (nekopara)|]] and [[Vanilla (nekopara)|]], whom the main character lives with, sleeps with and eventually has sex with. While Chocola and Vanilla are the main characters, the novel also includes a supporting cast of four other cat girls and the player character's sister.

h6. Episode 2

Episode 2, the third novel released, adds [[Coconut (nekopara)|]] and [[Azuki (nekopara)|]] to the center character group. The two were formerly members of the supporting cast. 

h6. Episode 3

Episode 3, the fourth novel released, focuses on [[Cinnamon (nekopara)|]] and [[Maple (nekopara)|]]. As with [[Coconut (nekopara)|]] and [[Azuki (nekopara)|]] before them, they started as supporting characters.

h6. Episode 4

The fifth novel released, Episode 4 focuses on the player character [[Minazuki Kashou]] and his family, exploring his past. It also introduces a new supporting character, [[Fraise (nekopara)|]].

h6. After

The sixth novel released, "After" focuses on [[Fraise (nekopara)|]] and [[Minazuki Shigure]] ([[Minazuki Kashou]]'s sister), both of which were previously supporting characters.

An otome game spinoff titled [[Nekopara - Catboys Paradise]] was released in 2021. The spinoff was originally presented simply as an April Fool's joke in 2019, but due to unexpected high demand, it would later be made into a full game.

title: loli
body:
[[howto:rate|Sexually explicit]] or [[sexually suggestive]] artwork of girls who appear to be preadolescent, regardless of canonical age (the "millennia-old unaging vampiress that looks like a grade-schooler" trope, for example).

[[Loli]] is applicable to ratings Explicit, Questionable, and Sensitive. Completely work-safe, non-sexual (ie, [[howto:rate|rating:general]]) artwork of young girls should not be tagged as [[loli]], use [[child]] instead. If you are unsure whether a post fits, ask in the "loli/shota check thread":[/forum_topics/8650].

title: nanakase_yashiro
body:
[[The King Of Fighters]] character.

He is the guitarist for CYS, a rock band consisting of and named after the initals of [[Chris (kof)|]] (C), himself (Y), and [[Shermie (kof)|]] (S).

They seemingly entered [[The King Of Fighters '97|The 1997 King of Fighters tournament]] to take revenge on [[Yagami Iori]] for canceling one or more of their shows, but as the tournament progresses, their Orochi blood awakens, thus remembering their status as the Four Heavenly Kings of [[Orochi (kof)|]] alongside [[Goenitz]].

He and Shermie sacrifice themselves to awaken Orochi, who would later use Chris as a vessel. But Orochi's awakening was short-lived as [[Kusanagi Kyou|Kusanagi Kyo]] (possessing the Sword of the Kusanagi), Iori (possessing the Jewel of Yasakani, and the target of CYS), and [[Kagura Chizuru]] (possessing the Mirror of Yata) combine forces to seal Orochi along with Chris' body.

He fights using powerful attacks in his normal form, and earth-shaking throws (throws that shake the earth upon impact) as [[Orochi Yashiro]].

title: imperial_warrior
body: The basic infantry of the Empire of the Rising Sun in Command & Conquer: Red Alert 3, the Imperial Warrior serves as a middlepoint between the Soviet Conscript and Allied Peacekeeper in terms of cost and makes use of a kinetic burst assault rifle as their primary weapon, but can, upon command, activate their wave-force katanas and psych themselves up into a banzai charge to deal one hit kills to enemy infantry in melee with a significant speed boost.

title: striker-vx
body: A type of transformation capable Helicopter/Walker used by the Empire of the Rising Sun in Command & Conquer: Red Alert 3. In its chopper mode it serves as a strictly anti-vehicle/ship/structure helicopter with its missile pods, but when transformed into a groundbound walker, it is the Empire's primary surface to air vehicle.

title: giga-fortress
body: The largest and most powerful transforming unit in the arsenal of the Empire of the Rising Sun's arsenal in Command & Conquer: Red Alert 3, introduced in the Uprising expansion pack to provide the Empire with a more powerful air to ground unit as well as the strongest naval unit. In its head mode, it fires its "god breath" wave force cannon as a massive beam at ground targets while flying in the air, while in sea fortress mode it has five turrets with heavy battleship cannons and a powerful surface to air missile system.

title: mecha_tengu
body: The primary anti-infantry and air-to-air vehicle in the arsenal of the Empire of the Rising Sun in Command & Conquer: Red Alert 3. Heavily inspired by the mecha in anime such as Macross, the Mecha Tengu has both a jet mode that it uses to engage other air units, and can transform into a semi-humanoid hovering mecha mode where it can use its autocannons against ground targets, particularly infantry.

title: empire_of_the_rising_sun
body:
A faction in Command and Conquer Red Alert 3 based on a combination of Imperial Japan, 80s-90s feas of Japanese technological dominance, and a combination of classic and (at the time of release) contemporary anime; particularly of the mecha genre and works containing espers. Created when the removal of Einstein from the timeline from the Soviets allows Japan to form the world's third power bloc to wage war against both the Allied bloc in the North Atlantic and the Soviet bloc sprawling across Eurasia. 

The Empire makes use of highly advanced technology such as nanomachines, plasma weapons, psionics, wave-force weapons, transforming and non-transforming mecha, and robots. Ideologically, Empire believes that the Emperor of Japan is a living god who must be obeyed absolutely and that the Japanese people have a divine destiny to rule the world, leading them to believe that it is their right to conquer the planet. 

The Empire is canonically defeated by the Allies and subject to American-European occupation as per Red Alert 3: Uprising.

title: eous_(zenless_zone_zero)
body:
The [[Bangboo (Zenless Zone Zero)|]] in [[Zenless Zone Zero]] operated by Phaethon ([[Wise (Zenless Zone Zero)|]] and [[Belle (Zenless Zone Zero)|]]). It is used to guide the Hollow Raiders through the Hollows, thus it is the most likely to be out and about.

It wears an [[orange bandana|orange]] [[bandana]] around its neck with the number "01" printed on it.

Belle and Wise own at least two other Bangboo identical in appearance to Eous except for the number on the bandana: [[Bangboo 18 (zenless zone zero)|]] and [[Bangboo 6 (zenless zone zero)|]]. However, since Eous is the one most commonly seen, if the number isn't visible or not drawn at all, it's fine to use this tag.

title: yoyami_rei
body:
Yamiyo Rei is a character from [[sailor_element]].

A confident and tomboyish dark-skinned demon, she takes pleasure in dominating humans and enjoys indulging in carnal desires. She has pledged her loyalty to Dia. In her human form, she takes on the role of Shuu’s (Dia’s human form) older sister and works as a teacher at the academy attended by Shuu and Kureha. Despite her strong-willed personality, she is known for being a serious and reliable teacher with a big-sisterly attitude, earning the respect and affection of her students.

title: shimonada_station
body: A [[train station]] on the JR Yosan Line, located in Iyo City, [[Ehime Prefecture]]. Although the title of "the station closest to the ocean in Japan" has been passed to the [[Oumigawa Station]] in [[Niigata Prefecture]], this station still attracts tourists with its nostalgic atmosphere and the view of the Inland Sea from the platform.

title: signora_(genshin_impact)
body:
A [[Genshin Impact]] character. Also known by the codename "The Fair Lady", she is the eighth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers and a major antagonist in [[Genshin Impact]].

Her real name is Rosalyne-Kruzchka Lohefalter. In her previous life, after the death of her lover, Rostam, she swore revenge against those who were responsible for his death, eventually becoming the [b]Crimson Witch of Flames[/b]. Upon joining the Fatui, she was bestowed with a Delusion to suppress her flames.

Like the other Fatui Harbingers, she is named after a stock character in the Italian theater genre "Commedia dell'arte":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commedia_dell%27arte].

h4. Costumes

* !post #5218510: Default
* !post #7756501: [[signora (crimson witch of embers) (genshin impact)|Crimson Witch of Flames/Embers]]

title: bigmouth_strikes_again
body:
Bigmouth Strikes Again is the [[Stand (jojo)|]] of [[Charming Man]], featured in the ninth part of the [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] series, [[The JOJOLands]].

Bigmouth Strikes Again is an integrated ability that affects [[Charming Man]]'s body, which naturally has a rough, sand-like texture. [[Charming Man]] states that while his skin texture is shared among his village, his [[Stand (jojo)|]] is his own unique ability. His skin can [[floating|float]] around him when he is using his powers, appearing like small sand and rock fragments. When it transforms [[Charming Man]] to resemble [[Paco Laburantes]], the real [[Paco Laburantes|Paco]] notes that the fragments have different colors.

Namesake: Bigmouth Strikes Again (The Smiths single)
other_names: ビッグマウス・ストライクス・アゲイン

title: charming_man
body:
Charming Man is a [spoilers] primary ally [/spoilers] featured in the ninth part of the [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] series, [[The JOJOLands]].

He is also a [[Stand (jojo)|]] user who wields [[Bigmouth Strikes Again]], which lets him disguise with his surroundings and confuse his enemies' perceptions.

Charming Man is an athletic build male, and dark, [[spiked hair| spiked]] [[medium hair]]. His hair is flat at the top with spiky bangs, and the back of his hair juts out in all directions. Charming Man wears [[makeup]], including eye shadows and dark [[lipstick]]..He wears light [[overalls]] with light [[bow]] on them.

Namesake: This Charming Man (The Smiths song)

title: hachikou_(dog)
body:
[b]Hachikou[/b] (1923-1935) was a [[dog]] belonging to Professor Ueno Hidesaburou of Tokyo Imperial University (current University of Tokyo).  He famously awaited his master's return home at [[Shibuya Station]] in Tokyo every day from the professor's death in 1925 until his own in 1935, for which he was honored with a [[statue]] at the station.  Today, said statue is a popular meeting place.

h4. See also
* [[Hachiko of Castling]] (aka "Hachiko of the Wall"), a character named after Hachikou.
* [[list of real life animals]]

title: nekomata_okayu_(new_year)
body:
The 2nd/New Years [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Nekomata Okayu]].

It's a [[wa maid]]-inspired outfit consisting of a white kosode with [[wide sleeves|wide]] purple [[ribbon-trimmed sleeves]] with a purple gradient, a [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[purple skirt|purple]] [[purple hakama|hakama]] [[miniskirt]]-length [[hakama short skirt|short skirt]],  a [[white apron|white]] [[frilled apron|frilled]] [[maid apron]] with an [[onigiri print]] on the bottom right, secured with an obi-like wrap, [[white socks|white]] [[tabi]] socks and [[black sandals|black]] [[okobo]].

For her hairstyle in this costume, it is the same as her [[nekomata okayu (1st costume)|default costume]] with the addition of a purple [[kanzashi]] decorated with a small [[jingle bell|jingle]] [[hair bell]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #3868917: Profile

title: inugami_korone_(viking)
body:
The 7th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Inugami Korone]].

It is a [[viking]] themed costume, consisting of [[leather armor|leather]] [[bikini armor]] with a leather [[single pauldron]] on her right shoulder, [[fur-trimmed bracer|fur-trimmed]] [[bracer]]s, a [[red skirt|red]] [[fur skirt|fur]] [[miniskirt]], [[black thighhighs]] and [[brown boots|brown]] [[fur-trimmed boots]] She also has an optional [[blue cape|blue]] [[fur-trimmed cape]] and a [[animal ears helmet]] with dog ears.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has [[long hair|long]] [[messy hair|messy]] with a [[side braid]] and decorated large [[bone hair ornament|bone]] on her forehead. Her [[dog ears]] are also folded down and blended with her hair, making it quite hard to spot at the first glance.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7451479: Profile

It consists of a [[sleeveless kimono|sleeveless]] [[two-tone kimono]] [[white kimono|white]] and [[blue kimono]] with a [[criss-cross halter]], a [[hagoromo]], [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[detached sleeves]] [[white socks|white]] [[tabi]] socks and [[blue sandals|blue]] [[geta]]. She also has an optional [[kadomatsu]] [[headgear]] that became quite iconic.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has [[very long hair]] with her usual [[bone hair ornament|bone-shaped]] [[hairclip]]s and [[sidelocks]] with [[hair tubes]].

* !post #3871456: Profile

title: inugami_korone_(wonderland)
body:
The 6th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Inugami Korone]], debuting in June 7th 2023.

Just like the rest of this round of costumes for [[hololive gamers]], this costume is inspired by [[Alice's Adventures in Wonderland]], this time being inspired in Alice herself. It consists of a [[black choker|black]] [[o-ring choker]] with a [[key necklace]], a [[short dress|short]] [[blue dress]] with a  [[heart-shaped lock]], [[chest belt]], [[chest harness]] and a [[side slit]], a [[white apron|white]] [[frilled apron|frilled]] [[underbust]] [[waist apron]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], a [[checkered skirt]] [[skirt under dress|under her dress]], a small [[potion]] [[vial]] on her waist, a [[black pantyhose|black]] [[fishnet pantyhose]] and [[black boots|black]] [[lace-up boots]]. She also an optional [[black jacket|black]] [[letterman jacket|letterman]] [[sukajan]] with [[white sleeves]] and a [[nail bat]] which she carries [[weapon on back|on her back]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has [[long hair]] tied into a [[two side up]] with a [[black hairband|black]] [[bow hairband]] and [[double-parted bangs]] with [[x hair ornament|crossing]] [[hairclip]]s.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6470849: Profile

title: inugami_korone_(loungewear)
body:
The 4th/loungewear [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Inugami Korone]].

It consists of a [[pink jacket|pink]] [[hooded jacket]] with a [[dog hood]] and long [[fur-trimmed sleeves]] and [[shoulder cutout]]s (or a [[hooded vest]] with [[detached sleeves]], depending on the artist) a [[black shirt|black]] [[t-shirt]] with a [[dog print|dog]] and [[bone print|bones]] [[print shirt|print]] with [[shoulder cutout]]s (although it's often depicted as just a [[black tank top]]), a [[black choker|black]] [[o-ring choker]] with a finger-shaped [[pendant]], [[blue shorts|blue]] [[denim shorts|denim]] [[short shorts]], a black [[thigh strap]], [[striped legwear|striped]] [[two-tone legwear|two-toned]] [[pink socks|pink]] and [[white socks|white]] [[loose socks]] and [[cat print]] [[slippers]], that match with Okayu's 3rd costume dog slippers.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has her [[long hair]] [[hair over shoulder|over her shoulder]] with a [[pom pom hair ornament]] with an optional [[pink hairband|pink]] [[hair bow|bow]] [[bow hairband|hairband]] [[bangs pinned back|holding her bangs back]].

title: herta_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Voiced by [[Yamazaki Haruka]] in Japanese.

She is the master of the eponymous Herta Space Station, who appears in the form of a puppet she modeled after her younger self, as well as an Emanator of Erudition.

She (or rather, her puppet) is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[hair intakes]], [[purple eyes]], and [[doll joints]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[white dress]] worn under an outer layer [[black dress|black]] [[sailor dress]], [[black hat|black]] [[beret]] with a [[purple flower]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots]]. She uses a [[hammer]] as her main weapon. 

h4. Skins

* !post #7689962: Splash art ([[herta (puppet) (honkai: star rail)|4-star]])
* !post #8704047: [[The herta (honkai: star rail)|Emanator of Erudition]] (5-star)
* !asset #23561803: Herta's [[Herta (Simulated Universe Avatar) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Simulated Universe avatar]]

h4. Profile
[expand]
Herta Space Station's true master.

As the human with the highest IQ in The Blue, she only does what she's interested in, dropping whatever project immediately the moment she loses interest — the best example being the space station.

She typically appears in the form of a ranged puppet. "It's about seventy percent similar to how I looked as a child."
[/expand]

h4. See Also
* [[Herta (Wisteria Cake) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Ruan Mei's creations: Wisteria Cake]]

title: world_war_i
body:
[b]World War I[/b] (WWI), which was predominantly called the World War or [b]The Great War[/b] from its occurrence until 1939 ([[World War II]]), and the [b]First World War[/b] or World War I thereafter, was a major war centred in Europe. It began on 28 July 1914 when [[Austria]]-[[Hungary]] declared war against [[Serbia]] and lasted until 11 November 1918 after the [[German Empire]] and the Allies signed an armistice. 

It caused the deaths of 40 million people (including both soldiers and civilians). The geopolitical changes it generated in most of the world after its eventual outcome were a direct cause for [[World War II]] more than 20 years later.

World War I is notable for stalemate [[trench]] warfare on the western front, and the development and application of new technology in warfare such as [[tank|tanks]], [[airplane|airplanes]] and [[submarine|submarines]].

h4.Factions 

[b]The Allied Powers[/b] 
* [[United Kingdom|British Empire]] 
* [[France]] 
* [[Russian Empire]] (until 1917)
* [[Belgium]]
* [[Japan|Empire of Japan]] 
* [[Italy]] (1915-1918)
* [[United states|United States]]  (1917-1918)

[b]The Central Powers[/b] 
* [[German Empire]] 
* [[Austria|Austro]]-[[Hungary|Hungarian]] [[Austria-Hungary|Empire]]
* [[Ottoman Empire]] 
* [[Bulgaria]] (1915-1918)

h4. Some battles

* Western Front
** [[Battle of Jutland]]

* Asian and Pacific theatre
** [[Siege of Tsingtao]]

h4. World War I in Popular Culture
* [[All Quiet On The Western Front]]
* [[1917 (movie)|]]
* [[Battlefield 1]]

h4. See Also
* [[ptsd|Shell Shock]]
* [[tag_group:history]]

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_I

title: adolf_hitler
body:
[b]Adolf Hitler[/b] (April 20, 1889 – April 30, 1945) was the Austrian-German Chancellor and later dictator ([i]Fuehrer[/i], German for "leader") of [[Germany]] from 1933 to 1945, as well the leader of the infamous [[Nazi]] Party, and writer of [i]Mein Kampf[/i]. 

Commonly known as the [i]Fuehrer[/i] and infamous for the racially motivated detention and killing of millions of people. Generally held as the individual responsible for starting [[World War II]], the bloodiest conflict in recorded human history.

Notable feature: his [i][[toothbrush mustache]][/i].

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:People]]
* [[Adolf Hitler (Artist)]]

title: gihren_zabi
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] franchise. He first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] anime TV series from 1979.

[b]Gihren Zabi[/b] is the first son of [[Degwin Sodo Zabi]] and an important, intelligent, cruel, [spoiler]genocidal[/spoiler] and ambitious [[military]] leader of the Principality of [[Zeon]].

Often compared to [[Adolf Hitler]] (even by his own father).

She has [[messy hair|messy]] [[grey hair|grey]] or [[brown hair]] with [[one side up]] and [[blue eyes]] with a [[mole under eye|small mole]]. Her outfit is [[magatama necklace]], a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[black shirt]], an [[open cardigan|open]] [[yellow cardigan]] with [[bandaid]]s, a [[yellow necktie]], a [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[purple skirt|purple]] [[miniskirt]], [[loose socks|loose]] [[white socks]], and [[black shoes|black]] [[loafers]]. 

She is often seen with other [[Voicevox]] characters like [[Zundamon]] and [[Shikoku Metan]].

title: elira_pendora_(4th_costume)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Nijisanji EN]]'s [[Elira Pendora]].

Dressing up for her [[birthday]], she now has a [[very long hair|very long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[blue hair]] [[multicolored hair|with]] [[white hair|white]] [[colored inner hair|inner hair colored]], a [[black headband|black]] [[headband]] that created [[hair intakes]], four [[hairpin|hairpins]] with two of them in the shape of a [[cloud]] and [[Pikl (elira pendora)|]], and a [[white ribbon|white]] [[ribbon]] that tied to the back of her [[blue wings|blue]] [[head wings]]. She also goes back to [[hair over one eye|covering her left eye]] with her [[long bangs|long bang]]. She can also alternatively have [[medium hair|medium-length]] hair.

It consists of a [[black choker|black]] [[choker]], a [[long sleeves]], [[open collar|open]]-[[collared_shirt|collared]] [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]] with [[buttoned cuffs]], and a [[clothing cutout|cutout]] in the [[center opening|middle]] of the [[shirt]], revealing her [[large breasts|breasts]] with a [[cleavage cutout]] and [[framed breasts]] that have a green [[tag]] attached to the left side with "xxx" written on it. A [[string]] is also tied around the [[shirt]] [[collared_shirt|collar]] with a [[padlock|pad]][[lock]] locked onto the [[string]] that also has "xxx" written on it. On her [[jacket on shoulders|shoulder]], she wore a [[grey jacket|grey]] [[jacket]] with [[notched lapels|notched]] [[lapels]] and a [[lapel pin]] that shaped like a cat (or [[Pikl (elira pendora)|]]). On the left arm sleeves of the [[grey jacket|grey]] [[jacket]], she wore a grey [[armband]] that had "3W1W4" written on it (similar to her "sub-Twitter account username":[https://twitter.com/3W1W4]). On top of her [[shirt]], she wore a body [[harness]] that looked like a [[chest harness|chest]] [[harness]] (worn [[underbust|underneath her breasts]]) with [[suspenders]]. She also wore [[black gloves|black]] and [[white gloves|white]] [[gloves]] with a [[heart cutout|heart]] [[clothing cutout|cutout]] on the back of the [[gloves]] and a [[wristwatch|wrist]][[watch]] on her left wrist. 

For her [[lower body]], she wore [[grey pants|grey]] [[pants]] with a [[belt]] that has a [[belt buckle|belt]] [[buckle]]. On her right leg, she wore a [[thigh strap]] with [[thigh pouch|thigh]] [[pouch]] used for storing her "DBJ" (Dumb Bitch Juice) [[juice box]], while on her left leg, she had a [[charm (object)|]] of [[famelira (elira pendora)|weewa]] with a [[purple ribbon|purple]] [[ribbon]] that had "[[famelira (elira pendora)|weewa]]" written on it attached to the [[belt]] with an [[o-ring]]. For her footwear, she wore a [[grey shoes|grey]] [[high heels|heels]] with a [[white socks|white]] [[socks]]. Her [[wings]] are also [[white wings|white]] now to match the theme.

[[Pikl (elira pendora)|]] also got a new [[official alternate costume|costume]], wearing a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[collared_shirt|collared]] [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]] (also has [[buttoned cuffs]]) with a [[traditional bowtie|traditional]] [[purple bowtie|purple]] [[bowtie]] and a [[white vest|white]] [[vest]] on top of the [[shirt]]. For its eyewear, [[Pikl (elira pendora)|]] wore [[white-framed eyewear|white]], [[rectangular eyewear|rectangular]] [[glasses]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6793700: Profile

title: pomu_rainpuff_(3rd_costume)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Nijisanji EN]]'s [[Pomu Rainpuff]]. Contrary to popular belief, and "#PomuGear":[https://twitter.com/PomuRainpuff/status/1631878111766749192] being the costume reveal hashtag, and the [[metal gear solid 2: sons of liberty|Metal Gear Solid 2]]-inspired aesthetic of the "costume reveal stream":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hCeTppLnHsQ, the "costume itself is not based on the Metal Gear franchise":[https://youtu.be/RrYAvRGAfrw?t=11676].

Tactically-themed, it consists of a black [[crop top]] and [[black shorts]] with a [[thigh pouch]] [[thigh strap|strapped to her left thigh]], [[black boots|black]] [[knee boots]], [[black jacket]], [[black belt]], and a [[black hat|black]] [[beret]]. She also has a [[knife]] as her [[weapon]], while her hair is colored [[grey hair|grey]] and tied [[side ponytail|as a ponytail to her left]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6135782: Profile

h4. External links

title: 2048_(game)
body:
2048 is a single-player sliding tile puzzle video game written by Italian web developer Gabriele Cirulli and published on GitHub. The objective of the game is to slide numbered tiles on a grid to combine them to create a tile with the number 2048; however, one can continue to play the game after reaching the goal, creating tiles with larger numbers.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2048_(video_game)

title: kuromajo-san_ga_tooru!!
body:
黒魔女さんが通る!!, lit. [i]The Black Witch Appears!![/i] is a Japanese children's novel series written by Ishizaki Hiroshi and illustrated by [[Fujita Kaori]]. The series was launched on Kodansha's Aoi Tori Denki imprint from 1980, releasing 15 volumes during its run. A television anime adaptation by Shin-Ei Animation began airing in Japan from April 4, 2012.

Whilst joining her friends in an occult session to find out which girl a boy likes, [[Kurotori Chiyoko]] attempts to summon the messenger of love, Cupid. However, due to having a stuffed nose at the time, she inadvertently summons a black witch named [[Gyubid]], who decides to train Chiyoko to become a black witch herself.

h4. Characters

* [[Gyubid]]
* [[Ichiro Mai]]

h4. External links

title: union_jack
body:
Also known as the [b]Union Flag[/b], it is the name given to the national [[flag]] of the [[United Kingdom]]. It is a combination of three different flags: the red St. George's Cross of England, the white St. Andrew's Cross of Scotland, and the red St. Patrick's Cross of Ireland.

Technically speaking, a [i]jack[/i] is a flag displayed by a ship, so the name "Union Jack" is incorrect when the Union Flag appears in any other context, but popular usage, as is so often the case, defeats technical correctness in everyday life.

The design of the Union Jack consists of a blue field, known as the Union Flag, with a red diagonal cross (St. Patrick's Cross) that extends from corner to corner. This cross represents [[Ireland]]. Superimposed on the diagonal cross are two intersecting crosses. The upright red diagonal cross (St. George's Cross) represents [[England]], and the white diagonal cross in the shape of an "X" (St. Andrew's Cross) represents [[Scotland]].

The Union Jack's design was first created in 1606 when England and Scotland were separate kingdoms but shared the same monarch, King James VI of Scotland and I of England. The flag was officially adopted in 1801 after the Act of Union, which united the Kingdom of Great Britain (combining England and Scotland) with the Kingdom of Ireland.

Also appears in the national flags of [[Australia]], [[New Zealand]], [[Fiji]], and [[Tuvalu]], as well as those of British colonies and territories. It is also on the flag of the American state of [[Hawaii]].

This may be confused with a mecha from [[Gundam 00]] called a [[Union Flag]] used by the world superpower Union in the series.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Union Jack":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Union_Flag]
* "Wikipedia: Flag of the United Kingdom":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom]
* "The Royal Family: Union Jack":[https://www.royal.uk/union-jack]

title: skyla_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Skyla[/b], known as [b]Fuuro[/b] (フウロ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon bw|Black and White]][/i].

Normally a cargo plane [[pilot]], this Gym Leader flies through the sky with her [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]]. Her cheery personality has earned her many fans. Her signature Pokémon is [[Swanna]].

She has [[blue eyes]], and [[red hair]] with [[short hair with long locks|long]] [[sidelocks|locks]] and tied [[one side up]] with an [[hair ornament|ornament]]. She wears a [[blue jacket|blue]] [[crop top|cropped]] [[turtleneck]] [[cropped jacket|jacket]] that exposes [[midriff]], [[blue shorts|blue]] [[short shorts]], [[blue gloves]], a [[thigh pouch]], and [[blue boots]].

Already popular for her attractive design, the [[2024 Pokemon Teraleak]] caused a resurgence in her popularity when leaked documents were found that explicitly called her a "sexy pilot", as well as Hispanic.

title: omocat_(style)
body:
[[Style parody]] of [[OMOCAT]], the creator of [[OMORI]].

OMOCAT's artstyle can be characterized by:
* The [[no sclera|lack of sclera]].
* [[Hatching (texture)|]], most prominent on the hair, clothes and skin.
* [[White pupils]] onto [[black eyes]] or [[purple eyes]] to show contrast between the iris and the pupil. If the iris is a much lighter color, the pupils will be black.

title: inugami_korone_(sonikoro)
body:
The [[official alternate costume|official costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Inugami Korone]] that debuted as part of a collaboration with [[SEGA]], the year-long [i]SoniKoro 2022[/i] collab.

Becoming an official ambassador of [[Sonic (series)|]], Korone's eyes turned [[green eyes|green]] and her hair turned [[blue hair|blue]] to match with her [[Sonic the Hedgehog]] [[hoodie]]. She wears a [[black shirt]] with Sega's logo on it and with [[no pants]]. She also carries a [[Knuckles the Echidna]] plushie on her right arm.

For the [i]SoniKoro 2024[/i] collab, a merch-only variant of this costume appeared, first revealed as part of Japanese pre-order bonuses for [[Sonic X Shadow Generations]], rendering her hoodie in the style of [[Shadow the Hedgehog]], while her eyes have turned [[red eyes|red]] and her hair [[black hair|black]] (referred to as Shadow Korone, or ShadKoro). Her [[black hoodie]] is accentuated with a [[fur-trimmed collar]] to match Shadow's fur tuff on his chest, and she's also seen wearing [[black shorts]], [[uneven legwear|uneven]] [[black thighhighs]], and Shadow's [[white shoes|white]] and [[red shoes|red]] hover [[shoes]]. The design would later be used for a collab cafe event.

h4. Appearance

* !post #5458319: Profile

title: bambietta_basterbine
body:
[[Bleach]] character.

Bambietta Basterbine (バンビエッタ・バスターバイン, Banbietta Basutābain) is a [[Quincy (bleach)|]] and a member of the [[Wandenreich]]'s [[Sternritter]] with the designation "E" - "The Explode". She is an extreme sadist and the self-proclaimed leader of "The Bambies", a loose group of female Sternritter. [spoilers]However, after being zombified by [[Giselle Gewelle]], she displays a far more meek and submissive personality, and is often abused by Giselle. This is implied to be her actual personality, and her sadism is merely a front.[/spoilers]

A young woman with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and [[blue eyes|dark blue-ish eyes]] in the anime, [[brown eyes|brown]] in the manga.

She wears her [[Wandenreich uniform]] with a [[white jacket|white]] [[military jacket]], [[white headwear|white]] [[peaked cap|peaked]] [[military hat]], [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white boots|white]] [[knee boots]] and a [[black belt|black]] [[heart belt|heart-shaped belt]].

title: boxboy!
body:
A puzzle-platformer series created by [[HAL Laboratory]]. Stars a cubic creature named [[Qbby]] as he adventures with his friends [[Qucy]] and [[Qudy]] throughout minimalist worlds only by making boxes.
H4. Entries
* BoxBoy! (Nintendo 3DS, 2015)
* BoxBoxBoy! (Nintendo 3DS, 2016)
* Bye-Bye BoxBoy! (Nintendo 3DS, 2017)
* BoxBoy! + BoxGirl! (Nintendo Switch, 2019)
H4. See also
* [[Kirby (Series)]]
* [[Hataraku UFO]]

title: rising_testicles
body: The natural movement of testicles during ejaculation.

title: sonoda_umi
body:
A character in [[Love Live! School Idol Project]]. One of the members of μ's. She is a member of the [[kyuudou]] club, as well as a member of the the μ's sub-unit [[lily white (love live!)|lily white]] (alongside [[Hoshizora Rin]] and [[Tojo Nozomi]]).

She has [[yellow eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with [[swept bangs]]. [[Kosaka Honoka]] and [[Minami Kotori]] are her childhood friends. 

Voiced by [[Mimori Suzuko]] (JPN), [[Kira Buckland]] (ENG).

title: commandant_(pgr)
body:
The player character in [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

Commonly referred to as "Chief" for their excellence in the military academy (ranking the highest among all students), the Commandant has come to lead the Gray Ravens consisting of [[Lucia (PGR)|]], [[Liv (PGR)|]] and [[Lee (PGR)|]]. They have also established far-reaching friendly or neutral with the majority of the game's cast, including those who were initially completely hostile such as the Ascendants.

The commandant is never shown in full aside from when they are wearing an exosuit in later chapters (post #9293979), instead normally being shown as a [[pov hands|POV hand]]. As such, this tag may refer to either their canonical depiction, an artist's depiction or an artist's [[original]] character being the Commandant (the original character should also be tagged).

h4. Appearance

* !post #9171586
* !post #9163498

A jumping scene common in the openings of animated adaptations of [i][[Manga Time Kirara]][/i] manga. The scene usually involves the main cast (typically a cast of 3 or 4) [[holding hands]] and jumping against a [[blue sky]], with each character's primary traits displayed in their jumping style.

title: ayla_(pgr)
body:
Playable character in [[Punishing: Gray Raven]]. Voiced by [[Itou Shizuka]] (formerly by [[Kayano Ai]]).

A construct painter artist in Babylonia, associated with the World Government Association of Art. She is a good friend of [[Selena (PGR)|]]. Prior to official English release the character name 艾拉 (Ai La) is often phonetically translated by the Asian communities into and not limited to: Isla, Ila, Ella/Ela and Aila.

title: bambinata_(pgr)
body:
A playable character of [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], she is <spoiler>the step-sister and</spoiler> a member of the Egret squadron lead by [[Vanessa (pgr)|]]. Voiced by [[Hidaka Rina]]. Her Vitrum frame is originally designed by [[D.K]].

Bambinata is very [[petite]] in appearance, most child like amongst all playable Constructs. She has [[two-tone hair|two-toned]] [[black hair|black]] and [[white hair]] with [[blue eyes]], typically depicted as a [[marionette]] [[puppet]] [[dancing]] [[ballet]] ([[ballerina]]) with [[puppet strings]] attached to her.

title: reverse:1999
body:
[b]Reverse:1999[/b] is a mobile RPG from Chinese developer Bluepoch. The game has gained notability as, unlike most Chinese gacha games, whose casts are voiced by Japanese or Chinese voice actors, the cast of Reverse:1999 is voiced by British voice actors who (with one or two exceptions) speak in English.

h4. Characters

body:
[b]Sophia[/b] is a non-playable character from [[Reverse:1999]]. She is a close friend of [[37_(reverse:1999)|37]]. 37 tries to reveal her number, but she rejects it as the time has yet to come.

She has [[red hair]] with a [[side drill]], and wears [[ancient greek clothes]].

She is voiced by Berkley Silverman in English and [[Kobayashi Yuu]] in Japanese.

title: blocking_way
body:
Blocking the way of the viewer or another character, thereby preventing them from accomplishing something, such as opening a door or getting at food. 

h4. See also
* [[blocking]] (for blocking an attack during a fight)

title: hooded_jacket
body:
A [[jacket]] with an attached [[hood]]. Oftentimes features a [[drawstring]], sometimes a pullover, often a zip-up.

[b]Not to be confused on Danbooru with [[hoodie]][/b], which is a hooded sweater.

h4. See also

* [[hooded track jacket]]
* [[hoodie]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: breasts_apart
body:
When the [[breasts]] rest far apart, either due to gravity pulling them apart or due to being physically held apart.

As a rule of thumb, the breasts should point away from each other and the skin over the sternum should be visible.

The opposite of [[cleavage]]. Not for when breasts are too small to touch, or when they don't touch because of something [[between breasts]].

H4. Examples
* !post #8441398
* !post #2962817
* !post #4107098
* !post #169877

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Breasts Tags]]
* "Forum Thread: [i]Tag suggestion: breasts_apart[/i]":[/forum_topics/7299]

title: partially_undressed
body:
When a character is partially undressed relative to what they are wearing.

This means that if the character is wearing a [[shirt]], and part of it is taken off, revealing a [[bra]], then this tag would apply. If a character has a partially removed bra revealing or practically revealing the breasts, then this tag would also apply. 

This tag could also be used for the implied removal of clothing, such as when the bottoms or top that a character would normally wear are not depicted on the character. Which could also be tagged as [[topless female]]/[[topless male]] or [[bottomless]].

h4. Examples

* !post #6574823
* !post #3256631

title: alexamenos_graffito
body:
A piece of Roman graffiti scratched into a wall near the Palatine Hill in Rome that is notable for being one of the earliest depictions of [[Jesus]], dated around 200 AD. It depicts a man worshiping a crucified, donkey-headed figure with the inscription "Alexamenos worships his god".

title: busoupo-ka-
body:
Poker Under Arms is a Japanese shōnen manga one-shot written and illustrated by [[Araki Hirohiko|Hirohiko Araki]]. Having been a "Selected Work" runner-up at the Tezuka Awards, this Wild West one-shot was  [[Araki Hirohiko|Araki's]] first published work and marks his official debut as a manga artist. The one-shot is included in Gorgeous Irene, a volumization of Araki's other early manga.

The story follows two wanted outlaws, [[Don Peckinpah]] and [[Mike Harper]], who find themselves facing each other in a game of poker. Both players are willing to go to any lengths to win, even if it means gambling with their very lives.

title: kikkoumon
body:
A [[hexagon]] pattern used in traditional Japanese art. Literally "tortoise shell design". Kikkoumon are used in family crests as well as repeated in different combinations to form various patterns.

Besides the Japanese context, kikkoumon can be distinguished from similar patterns like [[honeycomb background|honeycomb]] in that they often have multiple thick borders, and may have flowers or other traditional motifs inside them.

An alternate version may resemble intersecting or interwoven three-pointed shapes (see link below for examples).

h4. Reference

!asset #7734352

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Image composition]]

h4. External links

* http://www.aisf.or.jp/~jaanus/deta/k/kikkoumon.htm

title: cream_lemon
body:
Cream Lemon (くりいむレモン or くりぃむレモン, Kurīmu Remon) is an early hentai series. The first Cream Lemon OVA was released in August 1984, though Cream Lemon was not the first hentai OVA. The first was Lolita Anime, released earlier in February 1984. Patrick W. Galbraith writes that Cream Lemon "was by far the longest running and most influential" hentai series in the 1980s and "laid the foundation for pornographic animation in Japan".

Related to Cream Lemon is the [[Project A-ko]] franchise, which was meant to be the third installment of Cream Lemon but changed during production to be a mainstream film. The only remaining indication is the bath scene with B-ko. Adult entertainment company Excalibur Films dubbed, edited, and released in English five Cream Lemon OVAs as parts two and three of their three-volume Brothers Grime X-Rated Cartoons series in 1987 and 1989. In 1987, Brazilian distributor Everest Video licensed the series and released much of it on VHS, in uncensored form.

Cream Lemon is a collection of sometimes surreal stories having different settings and situations, with genres including [[fantasy]], comedy, suspense, sci-fi, action, drama, [[mecha]], magical girl, horror, and mystery. The overriding theme of the series is sex of almost any kind imaginable. Most chapters stand alone as separate titles, having no relation to any other stories within the Cream Lemon series. The main recurring character is Ami Nonomura, who has an incestuous relationship with her step-brother Hiroshi.

Cream Lemon often focuses on unrealistic and exaggerated sexual themes. One example is the story of a teenage girl who does not like having sex because of a series of rapes in her family. To cure this, the school counselor orders her to strip in front of the art class and masturbate herself to the point of orgasm. She then has public sex with a boy and likes it, causing the whole class to start having sex. Many others are similarly surreal.

title: lahabrea
body:
Recurring antagonist in [[Final Fantasy XIV]] and one of the leaers of the Ascians scheming from the shadows to revive [[Zodiark (ff14)|]]. One of the more openly malicious of his kind, he manically delights in causing devastation and bringing misfortune upon others.

Like most Ascians, he wears a double-fanged [[red mask]] on the upper half of his face, with most of his body concealed by a [[hooded robe|hooded]] [[black robe]]. He has [[white hair]].

[spoiler]An amicable version of him from his pre-Ascian past is featured in [i]Endwalker[/i] as a central character in the Pandæmonium raid storyline, where he becomes entangled in the events surrounding his son [[Erichthonios]] and an antagonistic splintered version of himself using his true name [[Hephaistos (ff14)|]].[/spoiler]

title: spiral_power
body:
Spiral Power, otherwise known as Spiral Energy, is a positive supernatural energy that defies the law of Conservation of Energy. In simple terms, it is energy that is produced from essentially nothing and can transform into matter. It is the energy manifestation of "fighting spirit" (i.e. the will to evolve, to advance, or to survive) of sentient organisms bearing double-helix DNA.

Spiral Power is often associated with drills, which symbolize the will to "move forward" from which Spiral Energy is produced, and is exclusive to the anime [[Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann|Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann]].

Should be used to tag posts that either:

A) Feature a character with glowing green spiral eyes
B) Feature a display of power or energy with a spiral motif ([[drill|drills]] and [[kamina shades]] optional)

title: mila_(miside)
body:
Mila is one of the many [[Mita_(miside)|]]s in [[MiSide]].

She has the same [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]] as other Mitas, but the red top has become a [[cardigan]], under which she wears a white dress shirt with a [[blue necktie]]. She wears [[glasses]], and has her [[short hair]] in a [[bob cut]] with a red [[claw hair clip]].

Of all Mitas not damaged or deranged, Mila is the most divergent in terms of personality. She's a [[tsundere]], with some qualities of a nerd/[[otaku]] and of a [[chuunibyou|chuuni]] as well. She seeks to be as distinct from other Mitas as possible, and distances herself from their affairs.

Her version of the house contains a very likely [[Koseki Bijou]] easter egg, involving a short [[katana]] and a miniature [[moai]] statue.

title: sleepy_mita_(miside)
body:
Sleepy Mita is one of the many [[Mita_(miside)|]]s in [[MiSide]].

Like most other Mitas, Sleepy Mita is a young woman of average height with [[medium breasts]], [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]].

Her unique characteristics that distinguish her from other Mitas include her [[red pajamas|red]], [[vertical-striped pajamas]] consisting of a [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[shirt]] and [[shorts]], a [[sleep mask]], and a [[blue choker]], along with her [[medium hair|medium length]], [[wavy hair|wavy]], sometimes [[messy hair]].

Often depicted [[sleeping]] or [[sleepy]], with visible [[zzz]]'s.

title: tiny_mita_(miside)
body:
Tiny Mita, also known as Broken Mita, is one of the many [[Mita_(miside)|]]s in [[MiSide]].

A unique Mita, Tiny Mita is a [[child]], wearing a [[red dress]], a [[blue choker]], and a [[large bow|large]], [[red bow|red]] [[hair bow]]. She has dark, almost black eyes and goes around [[barefoot]].

She is heavily disfigured, with bloodied, [[skin-covered_horns|horn-like]] growths on the left side of her face, an [[amputee|amputated]] left arm, and scars all over her body: on her [[scar_on_arm|arms]], [[scar_on_leg|legs]], [[scar_on_chest|chest]], and [[scar_on_face|face]], including a scar across her [[scar_across_eye|eye]]. The cause of her disfigurement is revealed to be [spoiler]Crazy Mita, who, jealous of Tiny Mita's cute appearance, killed Tiny Mita so many times that her ability to regenerate stopped working and she was left permanently damaged, both mentally and physically.[/spoiler]

title: cool_mita_(miside)
body:
Cool Mita, also known as Cappie, is one of the many [[Mita_(miside)|]]s in [[MiSide]].

Like most other Mitas, Cool Mita is a young woman of average height with [[medium breasts]], [[dark blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]].

Her clothing closely matches default Mitas - she wears [[red thighhighs]], a [[blue_skirt|blue]], [[pleated_skirt|pleated]] skirt, a [[red sweater]] and a [[red choker]].

Her unique characteristics that distinguish her from other Mitas include her [[teardrop tattoo]] below her left eye, her [[ponytail]] hair style, her [[blue gloves]], and most importantly - her [[blue_hat|blue]] [[animal_ear_headwear|cat-eared]] [[newsboy cap]].

Sometimes depicted with a [[hitachi magic wand]], due to an in-game scene where she accidentally shows it to the player.

title: crazy_mita_(miside)
body:
Crazy Mita, exhibiting some [[yandere]] traits, is one of the main characters of [[MiSide]].

Like most other Mitas, Crazy Mita is a young woman of average height with [[medium breasts]], [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes|eyes]]. 

Her clothing is identical to default Mitas - she wears [[red thighhighs]], a [[blue_skirt|blue]], [[pleated_skirt|pleated]] skirt, a [[red sweater]], a [[red choker]] and a red [[hairclip]].

Her distinctive features include her [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] styled into [[low twintails]], and a [[red hairband]].

She can optionally wear [[red-framed eyewear|red-framed]] [[glasses]] in-game, and has various outfits you can unlock.

title: kind_mita_(miside)
body:
Kind Mita is one of the main characters of [[MiSide]].

Like most other [[Mita_(miside)|]]s, Kind Mita is a young woman of average height with [[medium breasts]], [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]].

Her clothing is identical to default Mitas - she wears [[red thighhighs]], a [[blue_skirt|blue]], [[pleated_skirt|pleated]] skirt, a [[red sweater]], a [[red choker]] and a red [[hairclip]].

Her only distinctive feature is her long, [[straight hair]].

title: melynx
body:
Humanoid, bipedal [[cat]]s called Lynians from the video game series [[Monster Hunter (series)|]].

They can be distinguished by their black and white fur, in contrast to the white and brown fur of their cousins, [[Felyne]]s.

They're capable of speaking the human language and often find their way into human villages, finding employment as servants, surveyors, or hunting partners.

Wild Melynx are more opportunistic and travel in groups, stealing items from hunters and hoarding them back in their den.

h4. See also
* [[Felyne]]
* [[Canyne]]

title: redeemer_(spawn)
body:
The Redeemer is a recurring antagonist and ally in [[Spawn (comic)|]].

Heaven's answer to the Hellspawn. From time to time, the Ethereal Masters seek the assistance of the Star Hive: a heavenly, magical space station to create durable, loyal soldiers for the forces of God. This organization chooses mortals it feels are worthy and transforms them into angelic warriors on par with Hell's minions, specifically the minions of Malebolgia. Much like their demonic counterparts, the Redeemers carry the same limitless rage inside their souls, however the core of their anger is that of light rather than darkness

While many have done the mantle of Redeemer,Eddie Frank is the most popular version of this character

title: acheron_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
Playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Her name is taken from "the river located in Epirus, Greece":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acheron] which is said to be the branch of the underworld.

[spoilers]Her real name is revealed to be [b]Raiden Bosenmori Mei[/b].[/spoilers] Voiced by [[Sawashiro Miyuki]] (JP) and [[Allegra Clark]] (EN). 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with [[hair intakes]] (and turn [[white hair|white]] upon using her ultimate), [[purple eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[black shirt|black]] [[crop top]], [[white jacket|white]] [[flame print]] [[cropped jacket]], [[black belt]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], [[asymmetrical legwear]] ([[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots|thigh boot]] on her right and a black [[knee boots|knee boot]] on her left), and [[black gloves]]. She uses a [[katana]] as her main weapon.

Upon using her ultimate, her arms [[colored extremities|turn red]] and her gloves are replaced by [[red flower]]s.

h4. Appearance

title: the_godfather
body:
The Godfather is a 1972 American crime film directed by Francis Ford Coppola and produced by Albert S. Ruddy from a screenplay by Mario Puzo and Coppola. Starring Marlon Brando and Al Pacino as the leaders of a fictional [[New York City]] crime family, the story spans the years 1945-55, centering on the transformation of Michael Corleone from reluctant family outsider to ruthless Mafia boss while chronicling the Corleones under the patriarch [[Vito Corleone|Vito]].

The movie would later received two sequels, The Godfather Part II in 1974, which follows two plots; Vito's past and his rise as a Mafia boss, and Michael in 1958, where he is consolidating his power after becoming the new Don of the Corleone's and The Godfather Part III in 1990, which an elderly Michael tries to be a legitimate business man to atone for his past sins.

h4.External Links:

* "Wikipedia: The Godfather":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Godfather
* "IMDb: The Godfather":https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0068646/

title: wormadam
body:
[[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] #0413 in the National Pokédex.

Resembles a [[bagworm]]. Most of its body is covered in a cloak, which consists of different materials depending on its form. Unlike its pre-evolution, [[Burmy]], its forms are not interchangeable. Each form has a different secondary type.

Only female Burmy can evolve into Wormadam, with males evolving into [[Mothim]] instead.

Japanese name: [b]Minomadam[/b]

title: kama_(swimsuit_avenger)_(third_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[kama (swimsuit avenger) (fate)|Kama Swimsuit Avenger]] in her Third Ascension swimsuit from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Just like her regular Assassin variant, she is in her young adult form for her Third Ascension. Her hair is long, with the underside showing images of outer space. She has a black flower with black ribbons and a fiery tiara on her head. Her only actual attire is a purple coat cut into flowing strips that flutter around her. Her 'swimsuit' is little more than blue flames covering her genitalia.

In the summer 2021 event story, Kama is seen wearing a purple halterneck dress, and a one-piece swimsuit with a black flower at the top. As an enemy NPC, her skin turns blue, her hair becomes white, and the flames functioning as her bikini are now dark purple.

title: fergus_mac_roich_(fate)
body:
Saber-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

A character from the Ulster cycle of Irish mythology, he is the former king of Ulster who was tricked out of his kingship, and then later became the ally and lover of [[Medb (fate)|]]. He helped raise his nephew [[Cu chulainn (fate/stay night)|]], and is known to be a huge womanizer. He wields the spiral sword [[Caladbolg (fate)|]].

A [[fergus mac roich (young) (fate)|younger version]] of him appears in [[Agartha (fate/grand order)|]], who behaves nothing like his adult self.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[B Suke]]

body:
[[Fate/Zero]] character.

A slim young man with [[yellow eyes]], [[black hair]] combed back, (with a single lock that falls on his forehead), and a distinctive [[mole]]. Wears a tight fitting sleeveless [[blue shirt]], a brown leather [[belt]] and black [[detached sleeves]]. Wields two [[spear]]s, [[Gae Dearg (fate)|]] and [[Gae Buidhe (fate)|]].

Not to be confused with [[Cu Chulainn (fate/stay night)|Lancer (Fate/stay night)]].

title: kojima_hideo
body:
Born August 24, 1963 in Tokyo, Japan. A famous Japanese [[video game]] director originally employed at [[Konami]]. He is the director of his own company, Kojima Productions, and was promoted to Vice President of Konami Digital Entertainment in early 2011. His previous positions include being vice president of Konami Computer Entertainment Japan.

He is the creator and director of a number of successful video games, including the [[metal_gear_(series)|Metal Gear]] series of stealth games and the adventure games [[Snatcher]] and [[Policenauts]], and he also produced series such as [[Zone of the Enders]], [[Bokura no Taiyou]], and [[Death Stranding]]. 

Kojima is consistently named by fans and experts alike as being one of the most influential and innovative directors and writers in the video game industry, although he is not without detractors; notably, Agness Kaku, translator of [i][[Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons Of Liberty]][/i] has stated in a 2011 Skype interview that Kojima is "very bad at character" and "extremely conventional, as in non-creative, when it comes to plotting."

title: hotline_miami
body:
Hotline Miami is a pixelated, ultra violent, top down action game series by Dennaton Games.

The first game was released in 2012. Players take control of [[Jacket (hotline miami)|]], and are tasked by abstract phone messages to go and kill members of the Russian mafia. Jacket wears several named [[mask]]s, such as [[Richard (hotline miami)|]] the chicken and [[Tony (hotline miami)|]] the tiger.

It received a [[hotline miami 2: wrong number|sequel]] in 2015.
other_names: ホットラインマイアミ

title: lion_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the battleship HMS [i]Lion[/i]. Voiced by [[Oonishi Saori]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair|brown]]-[[blonde hair]] tied to a [[ponytail]], [[orange eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[red cape]], [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[red jacket]] with an [[aiguillette]] and [[epaulettes]], [[black bra]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[black boots]] with [[stiletto heels]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of a [[throne]] for herself, linking two large hull pieces containing her three 406 mm triple gun mounts (these were planned to be upgraded to 419mm mounts to perform better situations), while her throne has two 133 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]]s and her real-life foremast with a [[radar]] set. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #9336139: Default
* !post #9350592: [[Lion (the reclining dandelion) (azur lane)|The Reclining Dandelion]] (Swimsuit)

h4. Related character

* [[Vanguard (azur lane)|]] - built to Lion's design but with 381 mm twin gun mounts.

h4. See also
* [[Lion (Warship Girls R)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: [i]Lion[/i]-class battleships":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lion-class_battleship]
* "World of Warships: Long Live The King!":[https://worldofwarships.com/en/news/general-news/kabooma-matata/]
* "Lion (419mm mount) from World of Warships (entirely based on the design)":[https://external-preview.redd.it/OfV7eLREu2-9FIYJ1j0sKzH8ZSF7tFXMoklD6ByH2AA.jpg?width=640&crop=smart&auto=webp&s=a542e2b5e207770d58b683c073a97e43e3904203]

title: theresa_apocalypse_(schicksal's_imperative)
body:
A playable battlesuit of [i][[Honkai Impact 3rd]][/i]'s [[Theresa Apocalypse]], her default for the game's Part 2 story. 

Her "Schicksal's Imperative" outfit consists of a [[white hood]] with [[fake animal ears|false]] [[cat ears]], [[long sleeves]], [[purple leotard]] with a [[crotch zipper]], [[purple shorts|purple]] [[short shorts]], [[purple thighhighs]], [[white boots|white]] [[fold-over boots|fold-over]] [[ankle boots]], and a [[Teri Derp (meme)|]] [[eye mask]].

title: diantha_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Diantha[/b], known as [b]Carnet[/b] (カルネ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon xy|Pokémon X and Y]][/i].

Diantha is the Kalos Champion and also a famous actress. She's quite friendly and loves striking up conversations with skilled Trainers. She can often be found in cafés [tn](official bio)[/tn]. Her signature Pokémon is [[Gardevoir]].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]]. She wears a [[white choker]], a [[necklace]], an [[open coat|open]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[white coat]], a [[white shirt]], [[white shorts|white]] [[short shorts]], [[white boots|white]] [[high heel boots|high-heel]] [[ankle boots]], and [[holding bag|carries]] a [[pink bag|pink]] [[purse]].

title: mallow_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Mallow[/b], known as [b]Mao[/b] (マオ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon sm|Sun and Moon]][/i].

Mallow is a captain on Akala Island in Alola and works at a restaurant where she hones her skills as a chef. Her cooking is unique but popular among some [tn](official bio)[/tn]. Her signature Pokémon is [[Tsareena]]. 

She has [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]], [[green eyes]], and [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and in [[twintails]]. She wears a [[green headband|headband]] with a [[pink flower|flower]], a [[pink shirt|shirt]] under [[grey overalls|grey]] [[overall shorts|overalls]], and [[green shoes|green]] [[two-tone shoes|and]] [[white shoes]] with [[green ribbon|green]] [[footwear ribbon|ribbons]].

title: bill_cipher
body:
The main antagonist of [i][[Gravity Falls]][/i]. A triangle-shaped demon who causes destruction and madness for fun. Manipulative and tricky, with a very black sense of humor and a fondness for making deceptively appealing deals.

[[One-eyed]] with a long, black pupil. Wears a [[top hat]] and sometimes carries a [[cane]]. In [[personification|personifications]], he usually becomes a [[blonde_hair|blonde haired]] man with either a yellow [[suit]] or a [[waistcoat]], and often missing an eye. Wears a [[bowtie]] regardless of form.

[b]Major Spoiler[/b]

[spoiler]Helped the real [[ford pines|Stanford Pines]] build a multidimensional portal in the hopes of unleashing Hell on Earth and releasing his demon acquaintances in an event known as Weirdmageggon.[/spoiler]

title: gamepad
body:
The classic gamepad is a [[game controller]] that can be held conveniently in two hands and does not require any particular mounting surface nor an exact fixed posture from the user. The game pad provides basic functions to control a game such as Start/Pause, Select, 4- or 8-way navigation, and various different actions via other buttons (numbering from two to roughly a dozen). Among the first gamepads were those game controllers bundled with the U.S.-market [[NES|Nintendo Entertainment System]] or Japanese-market [[Famicom]].

Video game consoles through the 8-, 16- and 32-bit eras still feature gamepads as basic controllers and these may include analog thumbsticks. However, gamepads should be considered separate from [[joystick|joysticks]].

h4. Example
* !post #9226723

title: vlad_iii_dracula
body:
Vlad III, Prince of Wallachia (1431–1476/77), was a member of the House of Drăculești, a branch of the House of Basarab, also known, using his patronymic, as Vlad Drăculea or Vlad Dracula (Old Church Slavonic: Владъ Дрьколъ). He was posthumously dubbed Vlad the Impaler (modern Romanian: Vlad Țepeș, pronounced [ˈvlad ˈt͡sepeʃ]) due to his habit of impaling his enemy's corpses. He is well known for his resistance against the [[Ottoman Empire]].

The name of the vampire Count [[Dracula]] in Bram Stoker's 1897 novel [[Bram Stoker's Dracula|Dracula]] was derived from William Wilkinson's book [i]An Account of the Principalities of Wallachia and Moldavia[/i], where he makes reference to both Vlad III and his father, Vlad II Dracul, as "Voïvode Dracula", with Stoker copying in his notes the footnote on the name, where it revealed its meaning of 'devil', and that it was given "as a surname to any person who rendered himself conspicuous either by courage, cruel actions, or cunning." This has inspired later authors, prior to Stoker's own notes becoming public, to associate the historical Vlad III with the vampire Count Dracula, with several Dracula-based fictions (e.g. [[Castlevania (series)|]] series, [[Hellsing]], etc.) regarding them as the same person, despite the original novel itself dismissing the association after introducing it later on.

h4. See also

* [[Vlad Tepes (Eiyuu Senki)|]] ([[Eiyuu Senki]])
* [[Vlad Tepes (Hellsing)|Vlad Tepes]] ([[Hellsing]])
* [[Vlad III (Fate/Apocrypha)]]
* [[Vlad III (Fate/Extra)]]
* [[Vlad III (Moeoh EX)]]
* [[Tag Group:People]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vlad_the_Impaler

title: glitch
body:
Visual artifacts reminiscent of the long gone analog days.

Blocky displacements and bent images are characteristic of this style. 

Please note that this tag is intended for intentional glitches. [[jpeg artifacts]] and [[scan artifacts]] are unintentional defects.

Also note that simply the appearance of digital squares may be an indication of [[digital dissolve]] rather than an actual glitch.

Sometimes used creatively as a means of censorship (see [[glitch censor]]).

h4. See Also
* [[digital dissolve]]
* [[error message]]
* [[noclip]]
* [[static]]

title: glowing_eyes
body:
For eyes that shine. This could be a usual visual trait of the character or it could indicate the character is using some sort of special power. It can also be used humorously to indicate that the character is about to respond aggressively to an opportunity or provocation, often involving an unsuspecting victim.

If only a single eye is glowing, use [[glowing eye]] instead.

h4. See also
* [[Glowing eye]]
* [[Eye trail]]

title: phoebe_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Phoebe[/b], known as [b]Fuyou[/b] in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rse|Ruby and Sapphire]][/i].

This member of the Elite Four apparently gained the ability to commune and even converse with ghosts, thanks to her training at Mt. Pyre.

She is [[dark-skinned female|dark-skinned]], has [[blue eyes]] and [[very short hair|very short]], [[spiked hair|spiky]] [[black hair]]. She wears two [[hair flower]]s, a [[blue bandeau]], a [[blue sarong|blue]] [[floral print|floral]] and [[poke ball print]] sarong, an [[anklet]], and is [[barefoot]].

h4. Official art

* !post #1736266: [[pokemon oras|Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire]]

title: malasada
body:
A traditional [[portugal|Portuguese]] confection made from balls of fried dough coated with sugar. They are popular in many places with a significant Portuguese immigrant population, particularly [[Hawaii]].

Also the regional specialty of the Alola region in [[Pokemon|Pokémon]], due to being based off Hawaii.

h4.See also

* [[donut]]
* [[pastry]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: tablet_pc
body:
A tablet computer, commonly just called a tablet, is a portable [[computer]] housed within the casing of a handheld touchscreen display.  They appear like a larger version of the modern [[smartphone]].

Unlike [[laptop|laptops]], tablet computers lack a built-in [[computer keyboard|keyboard]].  Should not be confused with a 2-in-1 laptop, which is a laptop that features a touchscreen with the ability to flip or rotate so the display can conceal the laptop keyboard.

A popular example of a tablet computer is the [[iPad]].

Should not be confused with a [[drawing tablet]], which is a computer input device that enables a user to hand-draw images on a computer.

h4. See also
* [[holding tablet pc]]
* [[Tourbox]]

title: shimoneta_to_iu_gainen_ga_sonzai_shinai_taikutsu_na_sekai
body:
[i]Shimoneta: A Boring World Where the Concept of Dirty Jokes Doesn’t Exist[/i]

Light novel series written by Akagi Hirotaka and illustrated by [[shimotsuki_eight|Shimotsuki Eito]]. Adapted into a 2014 manga and 2015 anime series.

In a dystopian future, Japanese authorities are cracking down on anyone caught using any risque language or distributing lewd materials in the country, to the point where all citizens are forced to wear high-tech chokers analyzing their every spoken word. A new high-school student named [[Okuma Tanukichi]] enters the country's leading elite "public morals school" to reunite with his crush and student council President, [[Anna Nishikinomiya]]. However, Tanukichi quickly finds himself entwined with the perverted terrorist "Blue Snow" when she kidnaps and forces him to join her organization, "SOX," in spreading semi-pornographic material across the city.

h4. Characters

* [[Okuma Tanukichi]]
* [[Kajou Ayame]]
* [[Anna Nishikinomiya]]
* [[Fuwa Hyouka]]
* [[Saotome Otome]]
* [[Binkan-chan]]
* [[Nuregoromo Yutori]]
* [[Annie Brown]]
other_names: 下ネタという概念が存在しない退屈な世界

title: godot_(ace_attorney)
body:
A prosecuting attorney and [[Phoenix Wright]]'s primary rival in [[Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Trials And Tribulations]]. He is a huge coffee aficionado and sometimes speaks in bizarre metaphors before presenting an argument. Also notable for wearing a [[head-mounted display| red-lensed mask]] because his eyesight is poor.

[spoiler]He is actually [[Diego Armando]], who was once [[Mia Fey]]'s boyfriend, but seeks revenge against [[Dahlia Hawthorne]] for poisoning him into a 5-year coma, and against Wright for not protecting Mia from her death.[/spoiler]

[b]Japanese Name:[/b] Godou (pronounced [i]go-do[/i])

title: the_narrator_(fight_club)
body: The Narrator is a fictional character and the protagonist and main antagonist of the 1996 Chuck Palahniuk novel Fight Club, its 1999 film adaptation of the same name, and the comic book sequels Fight Club 2 and Fight Club 3. The character is an insomniac with a split personality, and is depicted as an unnamed everyman (credited in the film as "the Narrator") during the day, who becomes the chaotic and charismatic [[Tyler Durden]] at night during periods of insomnia.

title: looks_to_the_moon
body:
Looks to the Moon (aka. "Big Sis Moon") is a character from [[Rain World]].  She is an [[Iterator (Rain World)|]], and is the one with the most interaction with the player. Her superstructure has collapsed into the sea, putting most of her systems offline and with only her puppet and 6 neuron flies keeping her alive.

Her puppet has [[blue skin|blue]]-[[green skin|green]] [[colored skin]], a [[forehead mark|red circle on her forehead]], and [[robot ears]] resembling antennae. She may be depicted wearing an orange-brown [[robe]], a tattered white robe, or nothing.

title: iterator_(rain_world)
body:
In the game [[Rain World]], Iterators are sapient artificial intelligences running on semi-biological supercomputers of colossal scale (large enough to build cities on top of). Nearly always an Iterator is depicted through its "puppet": a [[humanoid robot]] which serves as a humanoid interface device. Each Iterator's puppet has a characteristic design which includes [[colored skin|skin color]], a unique [[forehead mark]]. and various styles of [[robot ears]].

Two Iterators can be met in the course of regular gameplay:
* [[Looks to the Moon]]
* [[Five Pebbles]]

An additional three Iterators cannot be met, but have a canonical appearance and play a major role in the events and lore of the game.
* [[No Significant Harassment]]
* [[Seven Red Suns]]
* [[Sliver of Straw]]

Consistently, Moon and Straw take female pronouns (and Moon self-identifies as "Big Sis Moon"), Five Pebbles and NSH take male pronouns, while Seven Red Suns takes singular neuter "they".

This number is mostly associated with the [[Vocaloid]] [[Hatsune Miku]], since 39 can also be read as such ('mi ku'). 

The number can also be read as 'san ku', leading to many Miku/[[Zaku]] crossovers.

Can also be read as 'san kyuu', which sounds like 'thank you' in English. This is played on in the song [[39 (vocaloid)|]] by sasakure.UK and DECO*27 and [[39 music (vocaloid)|]] by MikitoP.

Note: not all Miku posts should be tagged 39, only posts that incorporate the number.

March 9th is also the annual date of [[miku day|MikuPa]].

In the [[Rakurui no Tsubasa]] event, [spoiler]it is revealed that due to Ephemeros's anti-wish nature, she wished for Epsilon to be created to allow wishes to be made. To prevent the wish from from being rejected, Ephemeros would then completely forget about Epsilon.[/spoiler]

title: philipp_franz_von_siebold_(fate)
body:
Character appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Odoru Dragon Castle!]] event. He is the husband of [[Kusumoto Taki (fate)|]] and carries their daughter, [[Kusumoto Ine (fate)|]], on his back. He was a German botanist who visited Japan's port of Dejima to work as a physician and scientist, staying there for a total of eight years before returning to Europe. [spoiler]He is the master of [[Otohime Kiyohime (fate)|]] and [[Umisachi-hiko (fate)|]] while himself also being a servant. After returning to Europe, he discovered a Holy Grail in his old age and wished to reunite with his family, resulting in him manifesting as a servant back in Dejima after his human self left for Europe.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Araya (hachino araya)|]]

h4. Appearance
* !post #7835774

h4. See also

title: anby_demara
body:
Playable character in [[Zenless Zone Zero]] belonging to the Cunning Hares faction.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] with a [[side braid]] and [[orange eyes]]. She wears a black-and-green [[vest]] with [[detached sleeves]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[crop top]] exposing a [[midriff]] where the [[panty straps|straps]] of her [[black panties|panties]] are visible, a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]] with [[black shorts|black]] [[bike shorts]] [[bike shorts under skirt|underneath]], [[fingerless gloves]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[sneakers]]. Her weapon is a [[sword]].

Notably, in the beta she didn't wear bike shorts and her panties were directly exposed, but this was altered before release. This version is still sometimes depicted in fanart.

Anby serves as the face and human "mascot" of ZZZ.

Voiced in Japanese by [[Tanezaki Atsumi]] and [[Sam Slade]] in English.

h4. Appearance

* !post #9426375: Default
* !post #8991458: [[anby demara (silver soldier)|Silver Soldier]]
* !asset #26006849: [[anby demara (operation yum 2025)|Operation Yum 2025]]
other_names: アンビー・デマラ绝区零

title: rampardos
body:
A Rock-type Fossil [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]], #0409 in the National Pokédex.

Resembles a [[dinosaur]], namely a [[Pachycephalosaurus]]. Has a blue, dome-shaped cranium which is surrounded by [[spikes]] and obstructs its [[red eyes]].

Evolves from [[Cranidos]].

title: cranidos
body:
A Rock-type Fossil [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]], #0408 in the National Pokédex.

Resembles a grey [[dinosaur]], namely a [[Pachycephalosaurus]]. Has a hooked beak, [[red eyes]], and a blue, dome-shaped cranium with four [[spikes]] on the back.

Resurrected from a [[Skull Fossil]], and evolves into [[Rampardos]].

title: little_red_riding_hood_(fate)
body:
Minor character appearing in [[Fate/hollow ataraxia]] as the subject of a ghost story told by [[Mitsuzuri Ayako]]. She is a young girl who was a victim of familial abuse, wearing a [[red hood]] to hide the bruises on her face. After her mother killed her father and then committed [[suicide]], she supposedly went next door to ask her neighbor "Mr. A" for help before disappearing. The story is revealed to be based on true events during [[Fate/strange Fake]], with [[Sajou Ayaka (fate/strange fake)|]] being "Mr. A".

h4. External links
* "Type-Moon Wiki":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Little_Red_Riding_Hood
