title: buddhist_nun
body:
A female [[nun]] in [[Buddhism]], much like the Catholic counterpart, otherwise known as bhikkhunī generally (bikuni or ama in Japanese), or nisou in Japanese.

Usually in real life, they are known for their [[bald]] hair (as a requirement for Buddhist monastics) and robes. This is not always universally applied however, and in Japan, some Buddhist nuns do still grow their hair or if are bald, wear wigs. Bald Buddhist nuns in manga are less commonly depicted. 

In Japan, they also wear a white [[wimple]] similar to those worn by Catholic nuns.

title: cetus_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]]'s depiction of the sea monster from Greek mythology. [[Andromeda (fate)|]] was chained to a rock to be sacrificed to it by her father, only to be rescued by [[Perseus (fate)|]] using [[Medusa (fate)|]]'s head to turn the monster to stone.

As a servant, Andromeda utilizes the fact that she was chained to a rock along with Cetus' being turned to stone in order to summon it as her [[Noble Phantasm (fate)|]], Aethiopia Cetus.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[lack]]

h4. Appearance
* !post #9303437

h4. See also
* [[Pandemonium Cetus]]
* [[List of Fate series characters]]

h4. External links
* "Type-Moon Wiki":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Cetus

title: luxray
body:
[[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] #0405 in the National Pokédex, an Electric-type.

Somewhat resembles a [[lion]]. Its fur is mostly [[black fur|black]] with [[blue fur|blue]] accents, and it has [[yellow eyes]], [[yellow pupils]], and [[red sclera]]e.

Evolves from [[Luxio]] (from [[Shinx]]).

Japanese name: [b]Rentorar[/b]

body:

title: shirogane_noel_(summer_2020)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate]] [[swimsuit]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Shirogane Noel]], created by her character designer [[watao]] on their own in 2020, when there was no official swimsuit event at hololive. While it never received an official model debut, it would be used for merch.

She wears a [[two-tone bikini|two-tone]] [[blue bikini|blue]] and [[white bikini|white]] [[high-waist bikini]] with a [[blue skirt]] and a [[black choker|black]] [[star choker]].

title: nakamura_chizuru
body:
A [[Kokuhaku Jikkou Iinkai]] character. Student of Sakuragaoka High School's Class 1-4 and one of [[Suzumi Hiyori]]'s first [[friends|friend]].

h4. Appearance and outfit
Chizuru has a [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] and [[red eyes]]. She used to wear [[blue-framed eyewear|blue-framed]] [[glasses]].
* Like other characters, her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[blue jacket|blue]] [[blazer]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], and [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]].
* Her [[official alternate costume|alternate]] attire [spoiler]under pseudonym of Chuu-tan[/spoiler] may consist of a [[maid]] outfit or [[jirai kei]]-styled one [[no eyewear|without]] her glasses.
h4. External links
* "Confession Executive Committee Wiki":https://lovecommittee.fandom.com/wiki/Chizuru_Nakamura

title: bourbon_(kirby)
body:
A common object seen in the environments of [i][[Kirby (series)|]][/i] games, a flat, pole-like lump with rounded ends petruding from the ground. They may have details such as dots or stripes.

Although they usually go unacknowledged, "Masahiro Sakurai has referred to them as bourbons":https://youtu.be/ZUY2AtBD6Sk?t=728. The name likely comes from the Bourbon Chocoliere snack by [[Bourbon Corporation]] which has a similar appearance.

h4. Examples

* !post #2782872: Kirby and the Channel PPP crew walking around a bourbon, hoping it will turn into chocolate.
* !post #5670621: Kirby balancing on top of a bourbon.
* !post #8514857: Kirby and friends surrounded by bourbons.

title: fatalis
body:
An Elder [[Dragon]] in the [[Monster Hunter (series)|]] series. Often regarded as the strongest [[monster]] of them all, it is said to have burned down an entire kingdom within a single day. In a series filled with many exotic designs, Fatalis stands out in its own way by resembling a stereotypical [[western dragon]].

And in addition to the baseline version, there are also two subspecies, in the form of [[Crimson Fatalis]], which resides within a [[volcano]], and [[White Fatalis]], a very old variant atop a [[tower]].

title: vf-0b
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Macross]] universe.

The [b]VF-0B[/b] is the two pilot version of the [[VF-0]] variable fighter equipped with variable geometry wings, a single head-mounted [[laser]], a [[gunpod]] and several [[missile]]s.

title: vf-0a
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Macross]] universe.

The [b]VF-0A[/b] is the regular version of the [[VF-0]] variable fighter equipped with a single head-mounted [[laser]], a [[gunpod]] and several [[missile]]s.

title: vf-0s
body:
A transformable [[mecha]] from the [[Macross]] universe.

The [b]VF-0S[/b] is the [[commander]] version of the [[VF-0]] variable fighter equipped with two head-mounted [[laser]] cannons, a [[gunpod]] and several [[missile]]s.

It was the mecha of choice for [[Roy Focker]] in [[Macross Zero]].

title: yukikaze_(spaceship)
body:
A [[spacecraft]] from the [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]] sci-fi anime series from the 70s. It also appears in the [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato 2199]] remake from 2012.

The [b]Earth Defense Force Spaceship "Yukikaze"[/b] is a type of small and very fast and maneuverable [[space]] [[destroyer]] armed with [[missile]]s and energy weaponry.

The captain of this ship is [[Kodai Mamoru]].

title: argonauts_(fate)
body:
A post that features [b]four or more[/b] of the Argonauts from [[Fate (series)|]]. This includes the original Argonauts from [[Greek mythology]] and the Neo-Argonauts seen in the [[Atlantis (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt.

See {{argonauts_(fate) -atlantis_(fate/grand_order)}} for posts focusing on the historical Argonauts and {{argonauts_(fate) atlantis_(fate/grand_order)}} for posts focusing on the Neo-Argonauts.

The original Argonauts include:

* [[Jason (fate)|]] 
* [[Heracles (fate)|]]
* [[Medea (Caster) (fate)|]]/[[Medea lily (fate)|Medea Lily]]
* [[Atalanta (fate)|]]
* [[Asclepius (fate)|]]
* [[Theseus (fate)|]]
* [[Castor (fate)|]]
* [[Pollux (fate)|]] 
* [[Caenis (fate)|]]
* [[Peleus (fate)|]]

The Neo-Argonauts are comprised of:

* [[Jason (fate)|]]
* [[Achilles (fate)|]]
* [[Bartholomew Roberts (fate)|]]
* [[Charlotte Corday (fate)|]]
* [[Mandricardo (fate)|]]
* [[Super Orion (fate)|]]
* [[Paris (fate)|]]
* [[Mochizuki Chiyome (fate)|]]

While not historically Argonauts, Jason [[gameplay mechanics|can buff]] the "Argo-related" Greek servants [[Chiron (fate)|]], [[Circe (fate)|]], and [[Nemo (fate)|Triton]].

title: clip_studio_paint
body:

This tag refers to the interface or logo of the program itself. Use [[Clip Studio Paint (medium)]] instead for artwork produced by this program.

h4. See also

title: on_rooftop
body: Character(s) located on a rooftop. [[rooftop|Rooftops]] are roofs purpose-built to be walked on, a feature common in many Japanese schools, certain styles of apartment blocks, buildings with pools, gardens, lounges atop them, etc. Do not use [[on rooftop]] with [[on roof]]. On_roof should only be used together with [[roof]], the tag for roofs not intended for human traversal, like those present on traditional homes or pagodas. (post #5891954) h4. See also * [[rooftop]] * [[roof]] * [[on roof]] * rooftop barriers ** [[fence]] ** [[parapet]] ** [[railing]] * [[standing on building]]

title: hodr_(fire_emblem)
body:
Character in [[Fire Emblem Heroes]], introduced in Book IX.

The polar opposite of her sister [[Baldr (Fire Emblem Heroes)|]], Höðr is a shy, reserved goddess sent by her master (and father) [[Alfathor (Fire Emblem)|Alfaðör]] to apprehend [[Alfonse (Fire Emblem)|]] for accused crimes against the gods. She looks up to Baldr and is desperate to please her.
other_names: ヘズ(ファイアーエムブレム)

title: kizuna_ai_(kaguya_luna_live)
body: An [[alternate costume]] for [[Kizuna AI]], drawn by [[Morikura En]], depicting her looking forward to [[Kaguya Luna]]'s then-upcoming live show, [i]Kaguya Luna VR LIVE @ Zepp VR[/i].

title: evita_(arena_breakout)
body:
A NPC in [[Arena Breakout]]. A foreign doctor who came to Kamona to set up a clinic to help the locals after the Kamona Civil War, she serves as one of the many contacts for the player by giving them missions and also selling medical supplies. In the game, Evita gives the player several missions to find clues to help her search her missing father, Doctor Mihalio, who disappeared in Kamona. [spoilers]In her last mission, Evita reveals she is not Mihalio's daughter but an operative for a mysterious organization using an alias to find the doctor for their own reasons. "Evita" apologies to the player for the deception before disappearing.[/spoilers]

Evita is also a recruitable character during the [[Girls' Frontline]] crossover as a Handgun unit.
other_names: エビータ(アリーナブレイクアウト)

title: jr_103_series
body:
The 103 series (103系, 103-kei) is a [[multiple unit train|DC electric multiple unit]] (EMU) commuter [[train]] type introduced in 1963 by [[Japan Railways|Japanese National Railways (JNR)]], and currently operated by [[West Japan Railway Company|West Japan Railway Company (JR West)]] and Kyushu Railway Company (JR Kyushu). They were also formerly operated by [[East Japan Railway Company|East Japan Railway Company (JR East)]], [[Central Japan Railway Company|Central Japan Railway Company (JR Central)]]. And [[Kereta Api Indonesia|KAIcommuter/CommuterLine]]

* !asset #23103074: Various JR 103 series trains

H4. Examples
H6. Various Designs and Color Designs

* !asset #23103108: 103-0 Series in orange
* !asset #23103126: Different Cab Design in Yamanote Green
* !asset #23103136: Another Different Cab Design in Orange 
* !asset #23103149: Akabane Line JR 103-0
* !asset #23103175: 103-1000 A different Design with Gangway
* !asset #23103177: 103-1500 Different Headlights Design

title: fubuki_(one-punch_man)
body:
A character from [[One-Punch Man]]. Her full hero name is [i]Jigoku no Fubuki[/i] (地獄のフブキ, lit. Blizzard of Hell, [i]Hellish Blizzard[/i] in the official translation), and she is the 1st place ranked B-class hero of the Heroes Association. She is [[Tatsumaki]]'s younger [[sisters|sister]] and a powerful [[telekinesis|telekinetic]]/[[psychic]].

She has [[green eyes]], [[large breasts|large]] to [[huge breasts]], and [[short hair|short]] [[green hair|dark green]]/[[black hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] & [[blunt ends]]. She wears a [[green dress|green]] [[taut dress|taut]] [[collared dress]], [[necklace]], and [[black thighhighs]].

title: mihoko_(k-on!)
body: In season 2 episode 10 of [[K-ON!]], Mihoko is a former classmate of the members of [[Death Devil (k-on!)|]], who perform at her wedding reception. Her husband's name is Keisuke. She also appears in episode 26 to visit [[Yamanaka Sawako]].

title: yamanaka_sawako
body:
A secondary character of [[K-On!]]
The school's Wind Instruments Club adviser as well as its alumna, but eventually also the Light Music Club's adviser after being blackmailed by club president [[Tainaka Ritsu]] into the job on threat of revealing her past as "Catherine", vocalist and lead guitarist of heavy metal band "[[Death Devil (k-on!)|]]" and also an alumna of the same club. In stark contrast to her mature and gentle facade, only to the members of the Light Music Club - whose stage name "Ho-Kago Tea Time" was of her own invention - does she show her more authentic personality: lazy, irresponsible and often putting the band in [[cosplay]] dresses, but also perceptive and an able mentor.

title: kawakami_(k-on!)
body: Owner of the live house where Houkago Tea Time performed in [[K-ON!]] season 1 OVA episode 14. Although she is not a performing member of [[Death Devil (k-on!)|]], she was in the Light Music Club alongside them and was nicknamed "Janice". She was also the maid of honor at [[Mihoko (k-on!)|]]'s wedding.

title: k-on!
body:
A 2007-2012 (after a brief 2010 hiatus) [[4koma]] series written and illustrated by [[Kakifly]], with a 2009-2010 two-season anime adaptation by [[Kyoto Animation]]. A movie was released in 2011.

In order to save their high school's light music club from abolition due to virtually all of its older members graduating, four first-year girls - [[Hirasawa Yui]], [[Tainaka Ritsu]], [[Akiyama Mio]] and [[Kotobuki Tsumugi]] - join the club under the band name "[[Ho-kago Tea Time]]".

There are two sequel series named [[K-On! College]] and [[K-On! High School]]. The former shows the newly graduated girls going to college, while the latter shows Azusa and her friends form a new band.

A spin-off manga, [[k-on!_shuffle|K-On! Shuffle]], began publication in 2018.

title: heavy_metal
body:
A heavy sounding and agressive subgenre of [[rock (music)|Rock]] music.

Emerged from the 1970s with the bands like UFO, Black Sabbath, Thin Lizzy, [[Rainbow (Band)|Rainbow]], Cheap Trick and Motörhead.
and evolved from 1980s from bands like Venom, Judas Priest, Iron Maiden, Dio and Metallica.

title: death_devil_(k-on!)
body:
As seen in [[K-ON!]], Death Devil is the fictional [[heavy metal]] band fronted by [[Yamanaka Sawako]] (stage name: "Katherine", lead guitar and vocals) when she was in the Light Music Club in high school. The other members of the band are:

* [[Kawaguchi Norimi]] (stage name: "Christina", 2nd guitar and backing vocals)
* [[della_(k-on!)|"Della"]], bassist (resembles [[Tachibana Himeko]])
* [[jane_(k-on!)|"Jane"]], drummer

This tag covers the members of the band seen together, various versions of Death Devil stage costumes including Sawako's mask, and the main K-ON! characters wearing their costumes from season 2 episode 10, when they appeared on stage together with Death Devil.

title: pokemon_sm_(anime)
body:
The sixth series of the [[pokemon (anime)|Pokémon anime]] and is based on the events of the Generation VII core series Pokémon games. It follows [[pokemon xy (anime)|Pokémon the Series: XY]] and was succeeded by [[pokemon journeys|Pokémon Journeys: The Series]]. It ran from November 17, 2016 to November 3, 2019 in Japan and from May 12, 2017 to March 7, 2020 in the United States.

In this series, [[Ash Ketchum]] travels to the tropical region of Alola, accompanied by his partner [[Pikachu]]. Unlike in the five previous series, however, Ash doesn't travel through the region. Instead, he becomes a student at the Pokémon School on [[Melemele Island]], where he meets his new classmates [[Lana (pokemon)|]], [[Lillie (pokemon)|]], [[Mallow (pokemon)|]], [[Sophocles (pokemon)|]], and [[Kiawe (pokemon)|]]. After receiving a [[Z-Ring]] from the Legendary guardian deity [[Tapu Koko]], Ash decides to take on the Alolan island challenge to obtain new [[Z-Crystal]]s and master various [[Z-Move]]s.

h4. Characters
h6. Main characters

title: scarfy
body:
Scarfies are recurring enemies in the [[kirby_(series)|Kirby series]] which resemble floating orange cat heads. If [[Kirby]] attempts to inhale one, it will transform into an [[Angry Scarfy]] and chase Kirby down to attack him.

For more info, see their "wiki page":[https://wikirby.com/wiki/Scarfy].

title: bohegao
body:
A variant of the [[ahegao]] [[Saikawa Riko]] from  [[Kobayashi-san Chi no Maidragon]] makes when getting attention (which she interprets romantically, even if it's sometimes not really meant that way) from [[yuri|her love interest]] [[Kanna Kamui]]. Also known as "Kannagasm".

The facial expression is a typical [[ahegao]] ([[full-face blush]], [[rolling_eyes|rolled-up eyes]], raised eyebrows, goofy smile) with [[hands_on_own_face|hands on her cheeks]], a [[heart in mouth|heart symbol in the mouth]] and the eponymous "boheeeeee" (a [[sound effects|sound effect]] for a scream of exhilaration).

title: cope_cage
body:
An improvised slat armor canopy that the [[Russian ground forces|Russian military]] began equipping to the turrets of their [[tank]]s in the lead up to the [[russo-ukrainian_war|2022 invasion of Ukraine]].  They were pejoratively termed "cope cages" as a [[meme]] by online communities expressing their skepticism of the effectiveness of them.

Following the prevalence of [[drone]] usage in the [[Russo-Ukrainian War]] and the [[Israel-Hamas War]], Ukraine as well as many other countries have begun adopting cope cages as well. Tanks that have been seen using cope cages include the [[Merkava (tank)|]], [[Leopard 2]], [[Type 90 (tank)|]], [[Type 10 (tank)|]], as well as donated equipment in Ukranian usage.

h6. Real Life Examples
* !asset #26198752: T-72B3M (March 2021)
* !asset #26198743: Leopard 2A4HEL (March 2025)
* !asset #26198711: Type 90 (May 2025)
* !asset #26198712: Type 10 (May 2025)

h4. External links

* "Know your Meme: Cope cages":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/cope-cages]
* "Wikipedia: Slat armor (Top mounting)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slat_armor#Top-mounting]
* "Wikipedia: Anti-drone mesh":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anti-drone_mesh]

body:
A Water-type Legendary [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]], #0382 in the National Pokédex.

A [[whale]]-like creature with two large pectoral fins and a blue body with red accents and a white underside. Has [[sharp teeth]] and [[yellow eyes]] with [[black sclera]]e.

Sought after by [[Team Aqua]] due to its ability to expand the oceans. The mascot of [[pokemon rse|Pokémon Sapphire]] and [[pokemon oras|Alpha Sapphire]]; its counterpart is [[Groudon]], which it often feuds with. These feuds can only be quelled by [[Rayquaza]].

The [[Blue Orb (pokemon)|]] allows it to transform into [[Primal Kyogre]].

Japanese name: [b]Kyogre[/b]

h4. Official art
* !post #9441002: Kyogre
* !post #9443411: [[Primal Kyogre]]

h4. See also:
* [[Origin Pulse (pokemon)|]], Kyogre's signature [[pokemon move|move]].

h4. External links
* "Bulbapedia":https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Kyogre_(Pokémon)

Prior Pokémon: [[Latios]]
Next Pokémon: [[Groudon]]

title: googly_eyes
body:
Small plastic crafting items used to imitate eyeballs. Googly eyes are usually composed of a white plastic or card backing covered by a clear, hard-plastic shell, encapsulating a black plastic disc, mimicking [[black eyes]]. The inner black disk is allowed to move freely within the larger clear plastic shell, which makes the eyes appear to move when the googly eyes are tilted or shaken. 

Commonly stuck on inanimate objects to [[personification|personify]] them.

h4. Example

* !post #7676882

title: aaron_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Aaron[/b], known as [b]Ryou[/b] (リョウ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon dppt|Pokémon Diamond and Pearl]][/i].

Aaron, a member of the Sinnoh Elite Four, aims to become a perfect Trainer who is as strong and beautiful as his beloved Bug-type Pokémon [tn](official bio)[/tn]. 

He has [[green eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[green hair]] with [[hair between eyes|long bangs]] and an [[ahoge]]. He wears a [[black shirt|black]] [[sleeveless shirt]] with a [[zipper pull tab]], a [[white belt]], [[orange pants]], and [[white shoes]].

title: vaccine_scar
body:
Typically, uniform [[scar|scarring]] on the upper arm of anywhere from 6 to 18 marks as a result of receiving a vaccine using a stamp-like injection tool.  A common cause of this is the Bacillus Calmette–Guérin (BCG) vaccine to prevent tuberculosis.  The Japanese BCG vaccine uses a 9 needle injection device which is used in two places on the upper arm.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: BCG vaccine":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BCG_vaccine]

title: mato_seihei_no_slave

Also known as [b]Chained Soldier[/b], a manga published in [i]Shounen Jump![/i] in 2019 written by [[Tashiro Tetsuya]], with an anime adaptation developed by Seven Arcs airing in Winter 2024. The series focuses on the story of [[Wakura Yuuki]], a young man who is magically bound to be the slave of a magical soldier named [[Uzen Kyouka]] and is shared between her and her compatriots amidst their fight against "Yomotsu Shuuki", demonic entities from another dimension called "Mato".

When not drawn with her standard costume (the [[Dancer's Costume (DQ)|]]), she can easily be confused with her [[sisters|sister]] [[Minea (dq4)|]]. The difference is that Manya has [[parted bangs]] while Minea has [[hair intakes]]. See post #3966825; Minea is on the left and Manya is on the right. Despite appearances, they are NOT twins as Manya is 21 and Minea is 18.

title: super_mecha_champions
body:
Super Mecha Champions (also known as Mobile City X) is a third-person [[mecha]] battle royale game developed by NetEase for smartphones, and later ported to PC for Steam. 

The game is set in Alpha City, the location of the Super Mecha League, a championship where ace pilots from around the world and their representative mecha gather to battle for the top.

title: katawa_shoujo
body:
"[b]Katawa Shoujo[/b] is a bishoujo-style visual novel set in the fictional Yamaku High School for disabled children, located somewhere in modern Japan. Hisao Nakai, a normal boy living a normal life, has his life turned upside down when a congenital heart defect forces him to move to a new school after a long hospitalization. Despite his difficulties, Hisao is able to find friends—and perhaps love, if he plays his cards right."

The game was released on January 4, 2012. 

The story behind the game's development is quite unusual. The original idea for the game stems from a one page sketch by the artist [[Honjou Raita]]. A translated version of the page (post #22437) was posted on 4chan on January 4, 2007. The post received a huge response and eventually a group of people emerged that was highly dedicated to realizing the creation of the game. These people formed Four Leaf Studios and continued to work on it.

title: oppai_loli
body:
Used when a female child or child-like character has notably adult-sized breasts, but otherwise retains their child-like proportions. As a good rule of thumb, use the number of heads/breasts tall the character is to decide if they rank as an oppai_loli or not ([i]how many?[/i]). Also note that some oppai_loli pics still need the [[loli]] tag, but [[child|not all]].

h4. Distinction
* [[oppai_loli]] & [[loli]]: post #2015561, post #1320432, post #2116938, post #2298612
* [b][[oppai_loli]] & not [[loli]][/b]: post #891990, post #242796, post #337853, post #2257126
* [b]not [[oppai_loli]] & [[loli]][/b]: post #2342073, post #2220748, post #2374612, post #2326961
* [b]not [[oppai_loli]] & not [[loli]][/b]: post #2404319

If you are not sure whether or not a post should be tagged as loli, ask in the "loli/shota check thread":[/forum/show/33650].

Note that despite using Japanese words, this is an english term, in Japanese these characters are typically called "loli kyonyuu".

h4. Related Tags

* [[child]]
* [[loli]]

title: howto:contribute
body:
h4. Lurker to Contributor Transformation Guide

Lurked long enough and want to start posting something? If you have just made an account, it would be a good idea to make sure you know the rules and content guidelines before submitting anything.

Please keep in mind that [b]everything you submit is a contribution[/b], from comments and tag edits to uploads and translations. Everything you do here should be about the content of the site and making it better.

h4#how-to-danbooru. How to Danbooru

These rules apply to every part of our site:
* "Terms of Service":/static/terms_of_service ("Terms")
** "Upload Rules":/help/upload_rules
** "Community Rules":/help/community_rules

It would be good to know how Danbooru works:
* [[howto:get_started|The Lurker Guide]], if you haven't done so.
* "Search cheatsheet":/help/cheatsheet
* "DText cheatsheet":/static/dtext_help

h4. Tags

Want to help out with adding tags to posts? You are about to take part in one of Danbooru's most important efforts. Therefore you should know the tagging standards we expect from you.
* Check out high-scoring posts (search: {{score:>50 gentags:>20}}), as highly scored posts tend to also be well-tagged, and some not-so-good tagging (search: {{tagme}}).
* Read the [[howto:tag|Tagging Guidelines]]. Know the guidelines for creating new tags.
* Check out the [[howto:tag_checklist|Tag Checklist]], our measure of tagging quality on Danbooru.
* Learn how to use the "Tag Search":[/tags]

Also know the process of creating new tags:
* Only create new tags when absolutely necessary
* Creating [[howto:copyright|Copyright Tags]]
* Creating [[howto:character|Character Tags]]
* Learn when and how to use [[help:qualifiers|Qualifiers]] (those things in the parentheses).

Those interested in tag gardening and uploading should know about the How do I tag this? thread, where users can ask for help with tagging: topic #12251.

h4. Posts (Uploading)

Posts are the blood and bone of Danbooru. We pride ourselves for having the best picture collection on the internet, and we expect you to maintain the standard. Before you upload anything, we would like you to:
* Read the Upload Rules. See "How to Danbooru":#dtext-how-to-danbooru above.
* Know the upload [[about:mod_queue|Moderation Process]]

Other useful things to know about:
* The [[howto:appeal|Deletion Appeal]] process.
* The upload feedback thread: topic #7934.

More Protips:
* Remember to tag what you upload. All new posts are expected to be tagged to at least Level 1 per the [[howto:tag_checklist|Tag Checklist]].
* It is a good idea to learn how to tag (see above) before uploading.
* If you don't know where to start, from time to time Approvers will submit under-posted artists to the Upload Bounty Thread: topic #24186.

h4. Rating 

Please help out by making sure that all posts are properly rated. This is required for "Donmai.moe":[https://donmai.moe] to work properly.

* Read the [[howto:rate|Rating Guidelines]] for rating sexual content.
* Extreme violence or depictions of body mutilation must be tagged with the [[guro]] tag.

Just to get into the right kind of thinking:
* Posts with a general rating ({{rating:g}}) would be things you could show to someone in public.
* Posts with a sensitive rating ({{rating:s}}) would be things you will be comfortable viewing in art class in high school.
* donmai.moe only displays posts with a rating of general. Improper rating may cause donmai.moe to show unwanted posts.

When in doubt, you can always request help in the Ratings Check Thread: topic #8495.

h4. Comments

Do you have something to say about a post that you have seen? Before posting a comment on any post, make sure you have read the "community rules":[/help/community_rules].
Remember that you can use the [b]No bump[/b] option when posting follow-up comments, which makes the comment not appear at the top of the "Comments page":/comments. Your use of non-bumping is very much appreciated.

h4. Forum

Before posting on the forum, make sure you have read the [[help:community rules|Community Rules]].
The Forums are [b]only[/b] for issues concerning content (like posts, and tags), Danbooru bugs and suggestions. Nothing personal should be posted.

[[help:bulk_update_requests|Bulk Update Requests]] allow you to formally propose changes to tags on the forum. It's a good idea for all contributors to know at least the basics of the BUR process.

The Useful Threads Index in topic #8235 contains a list of frequently-used threads for requests and discussions.

h4. Pools

Do you think some posts you have been browsing should be in a pool? Check out:
* Our [[help:pools|Pool Guidelines]]
* The Pointless Pools Forum (topic #8282), where pools are reported for deletion. Reading the posts in there will give you an idea of how not to create a pool.
* Examples of good use for pools: 4koma Manga Series (pool #678), Untaggable Theme (pool #1886)
* A discussion on Pools That Should Be Tags (topic #8956).


h4. Translation Notes

Here's what you need to know before placing notes on a post:
* [[help:notes|Note guidelines]].
* [[about:note_formatting|CSS and HTML formatting in notes]].

h4. Artists

If you are helping mantain the Artist database, check out the [[help:artists|Danbooru Artist Guidelines]].

Forum threads to know about:
* The artist alias request thread: topic #7713. Please also familiarize yourself with "the thread's guidelines":/forum_posts/46810.
* The artist tagging help thread: topic #8199

h4. Wiki

If you would like to contribute to the wiki, please make sure you:
* Have read the [[howto:wiki|Wiki Quality Guidelines]]
* Know about the Pointless Wikis thread (topic #7690)

[b]Thanks for Contributing![/b]

h4. Go Back

* "Return to Information for Lurkers and New Users":/wiki_pages/help:toc.html#dtext-information_for_lurkers_and_new_users
* "Return to the Table of Contents":/help/toc
* "Return to the Wiki Help Home Page":/help/home

title: chisel
body:
A chisel is a wedged hand tool with a characteristically shaped cutting edge on the end of its blade, for carving or cutting a hard material (e.g. wood, stone, or metal). The tool can be used by hand, struck with a mallet, or applied with mechanical power.
 
The handle and blade of some types of chisel are made of metal or wood with a sharp edge in it.

title: finger_on_trigger
body:
[[Holding gun|Holding a gun]] with the finger on the trigger or inside the trigger guard, especially when not prepared to safely [[firing|fire]] it. The opposite of [[trigger discipline]].

It is possible for someone [[dual wielding]] to practice [[trigger discipline]] with one hand and not the other, e.g. post #1188474.

h4. See also

* [[holding gun]]
* [[trigger discipline]]
* [[military operator]]

title: buddhist_flag
body:
A [[flag]] consisting of five vertical stripes with the last stripe turned into a uppercase L, with the other 4 colors as stripes horizontally. The first and fifth colors differ depending on the nation, but the center three stripes are always yellow, red, and white in that order.

title: sperm_cell
body:
Frequently a spermatozoon in this context. They are cells involved in sexual reproduction.

Human spermatozoa are oval-shaped cells whith a single and long flagellum used for locomotion.

title: tortoise
body:
[b]Tortoises[/b] are terrestrial [[turtle]]s. They frequently have higher domed [[shell]]s than turtles, as living on land means they do not need to be streamlined for [[swimming]], and thicker legs to support their weight.

h4. See also
* [[Galapagos Tortoise]]

title: accordion
body:
An accordion is a bellow-driven [[instrument]]. It usually has a rectangular bellow and asymmetrical sides with keys sticking out on one side.

If the sides look symmetrical and the bellow is square, hexagonal or octagonal, it’s probably a [[concertina]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #2466981

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Accordion":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Accordion]

title: geese_howard
body:
A recurring villain of [[SNK]]'s [[Fatal Fury]], [[Ryuuko no Ken|Art of Fighting]], and [[The King of Fighters]] series.

Voiced primarily by Kong Kuwata, he is infamous for his [[Engrish text|Engrish]] quotes across numerous titles. When he's not wearing a nice suit, he is almost always fighting wearing a [[red hakama]].
